{"seo": [], "title": "Empowering Female Made & Led Entreprises KCB’s Commitment to Financial Inclusion", "years": ["2023"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Wed-10-2023", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In a bid to empower women entrepreneurs, the FLME proposition is revolutionizing access to financial and non-financial support tailored to their specific needs. With FLME, women in business are not only gaining access to crucial financial resources but also the knowledge and networks needed to thrive in today's competitive market landscape.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“In Kenya's bustling business landscape, women play an indispensable role in running businesses while nurturing families, communities, and the society at large. These virtual sessions empower women with knowledge and resources essential for navigating the dynamic business landscape.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Ultimately, the success stories of FLME customers stand as powerful testimonials to the transformative support provided by the bank. Shockingly, 61% of the unlicensed SMEs are owned by women, as reported by the Kenya Association of Manufacturers.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Research highlights a critical issue faced by women entrepreneurs: their traditional responsibilities, such as family commitments, can often hinder the success of their businesses. The reasons behind this gap are multifaceted, including a lack of personal assets and credit history, sexual stereotyping, and discrimination.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Supply-side factors further hinder women's access to formal credit. To make this a reality, we've streamlined credit requirements and documentation for faster loan processing.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Additionally, we're collaborating with partner organizations, like Kayana, KNCCI, KAWBO and more to provide non-financial support to women entrepreneurs. Through this newsletter, we aim to educate, empower, and inspire you to grow your business and achieve your goals.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Perhaps you've never borrowed from a bank for your own reasons, but as you contemplate the growth of your business, you need a financial partner who understands your unique needs. KCB Bank, through FLME, is here to be that partner, supporting you every step of the way.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Join us in this journey of empowerment, and let's together transform the landscape for female entrepreneurs in Kenya. We look forward to sharing valuable insights and fostering a prosperous future for all.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "10.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Spearheaded by KCB Bank, this initiative aims to break barriers by easing credit requirements and documentation, ensuring faster loan processing periods. {"seo": [], "title": "Embark on a Journey to Credit Excellence", "years": ["2023"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Wed-10-2023", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Credit scoring, is an intricate art of financial evaluation, which weaves together a tapestry of your financial characteristics into a singular score, painting a portrait of your creditworthiness. These scores are not mere numbers; they are the keys to unlocking financial opportunities and a testament to your credit prowess. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In our world, the scores are more than just numbers; they are gateways to an array of lending products. Are you playing it safe or living on the edge?", "type": "text"}]}]}, {"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Credit History Length:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " Like fine wine, a well-aged credit history is a treasure. The longer it has been, the more precious it becomes in the eyes of credit scoring.", "type": "text"}]}]}, {"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Types of Credit:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " Diversity is the spice of life, and credit scoring agrees. Frequent credit applications might raise an eyebrow or two in the credit world, possibly indicating financial turbulence.", "type": "text"}]}]}, {"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Public Records:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " The score keeps a watchful eye on the skeletons in your financial closet. Bankruptcies, liens, judgments - these are the specters that can haunt your credit score.", "type": "text"}]}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Now, let's turn the spotlight on how you can elevate your credit score and turn it into a soaring symphony: ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "bulletList", "content": [{"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Pay Your Loans on Time:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " The timeless melody of timely payments can elevate your credit score like a crescendo in a symphony.", "type": "text"}]}]}, {"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Maintain a Long Credit History:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " Keep the classics alive; let your older accounts serenade your score with their mellowness.", "type": "text"}]}]}, {"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Diversify Your Credit:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " Like a masterful conductor, mix different credit types responsibly - credit cards, loans, mortgages - to create a harmonious ensemble of credit.", "type": "text"}]}]}, {"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Avoid Rushing into New Credit:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " Don't let impatience overshadow your financial orchestra; opening too many new accounts in a short span may disrupt the rhythm.", "type": "text"}]}]}, {"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Address CRB Issues:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " If the credit report has a few sour notes, make amends. {"seo": [], "title": "Flamer of the Month Victoria Kieti: A Visionary's Journey from Employment to Entrepreneurship", "years": ["2023"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Wed-10-2023", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In the heart of Makunga , Kitale in Trans Nzoia County a remarkable story of perseverance, ambition, and community transformation unfolds. Victoria Kieti, a 41-year-old entrepreneur, has paved her own path in the oil and petroleum industry, breaking free from the constraints of employment and embarking on a journey that promises to leave an indelible mark on her community and beyond. We met Victoria during one of our FLME engagements in Trans Nzoia County and she is our Flamer of the Month. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Victoria's journey in entrepreneurship began when she partnered with Rubis,  and opened a petrol station, which has now been serving the community by employing over 18 people for two and a half years. This venture marks just the beginning of a grander plan of being a stopover for travelers heading to Lodwar, and South Sudan. In the pipeline is a resort where travelers can relax and rejuvenate on their journey. This is the embodiment of Victoria's dream, a dream fueled by her yearning for freedom, primarily in the form of time, to focus on her family, social life, and her love for village living. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A Vision from the Corporate World to Community Empowerment", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}, {"type": "italic"}]}, {"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Employed for 15 years, Victoria always harbored the dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Her motivation lay in regaining her freedom, and she recognized that true freedom was synonymous with regaining control of her time. It was during her corporate journey that the foundation of her vision was laid, and when the moment came to transition from employment to entrepreneurship, she knew exactly the lifestyle she wanted to create for herself and her community. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This vision crystallized into the concept of a stopover destination, where the petrol station was just the initial phase, followed by a resort. Building something substantial was challenging, especially after leaving a steady paycheck behind, but Victoria's background in brand management drove her to create a lasting legacy, one that would endure for generations to come. Her commitment to the community and a deep connection to her roots led her back to the town of Kitale. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Empowering Through Collaboration", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}, {"type": "italic"}]}, {"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Victoria's strategy was simple - leverage her husband's family land, her diverse experiences from various countries and businesses, and bring something extraordinary to her community. The transition was far from easy, but by actively engaging with the local culture and community, she found innovative solutions to overcome the challenges. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Integration with the community has been instrumental in her success, creating a harmonious partnership that benefits both sides. As Victoria embraced a slower pace of life in Kitale, she savored the simplicity and cherished the family time that became readily available. Her son transitioned seamlessly into the local school, and the whole family embraced the change. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Empowering Women for a Brighter Future", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}, {"type": "italic"}]}, {"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Victoria sees a bright future for women in business, and she is passionate about supporting this vision. Her interaction with KCB, her bank, has demonstrated the power of corporate support. She commends KCB for reaching out to their customers and gaining feedback, a vital step toward progress. Furthermore, she believes in the significance of uplifting women-led businesses, as empowering women empowers entire communities. She foresees a partnership between KCB and her community that can propel women toward success. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "KCB’s  Impact on Victoria's Journey", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}, {"type": "italic"}]}, {"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Victoria's partnership with KCB goes beyond a traditional banking relationship. KCB believed in her vision when she took the first leap, offering her a loan to start her petrol station. And when unexpected challenges arose, KCB provided an unsecured facility to ensure the station's success. In her words, KCB played an instrumental role in her journey, without which she might not be where she is today. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Looking Ahead", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}, {"type": "italic"}]}, {"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Victoria's vision extends far beyond her own success. She is passionate about making a meaningful impact, particularly in her community. From educating children to providing employment for families, her influence is tangible. Her shop with a partnership with Rubies has brought goods and services previously unseen in the community, enhancing the local lifestyle. Her approach is simple yet profound - by positively affecting her community, she is sowing seeds of change. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Victoria's message to the youth and aspiring entrepreneurs is clear: seek mentors, learn from those who have walked the path before you, embrace hard work, and use your network to overcome challenges. In a world where jobs are becoming increasingly scarce, entrepreneurship offers a path forward. It is not about waiting for opportunities but creating them. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Watch the video in the link below to get to learn more about Victoria’s remarkable journey. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LD9t84lVTjE&t=19s", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "link", "attrs": {"rel": null, "href": "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LD9t84lVTjE&t=19s", "title": null, "target": null}}]}]}], "article_image": "10.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Victoria Kieti, a 41-year-old entrepreneur, has paved her own path in the oil and petroleum industry, breaking free from the constraints of employment and embarking on a journey that promises to leave an indelible mark on her community and beyond.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "flamer_of_the_month_victoria_kieti_a_visionarys_journey_from_employment_to_entrepreneurship.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Empowering Young People in Kenya: Mastercard Foundation and KCB Foundation's Transformative Partnership.", "years": ["2023"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Mon-10-2023", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The young people in Africa represent a powerful force for economic growth and innovation. However, the continent faces a significant challenge: unemployment amongst young women and men. To address this pressing issue, Mastercard Foundation partnered with KCB Foundation to launch a transformative partnership that promises to upskill, incubate, and finance the young women and men of Kenya.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Urgent Need for Young Adult Employment in Kenya", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Kenya, like many African nations, is home to a growing young population with immense potential. However, this demographic dividend can turn into a demographic crisis if these young people are unable to find meaningful employment. It is estimated that in the next five years, approximately six million Kenyans will be either unemployed or underemployed.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A Goal Worth Pursuing", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In light of this challenge, Mastercard Foundation and KCB Foundation have set an ambitious yet attainable goal: to empower five million young Kenyans with dignified and fulfilling work by the year 2030. {"seo": [], "title": "How to Be Money Smart Through Budgeting", "years": ["2022"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q3"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-08-2022", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Doh ime evolve over the years. From days of barter trade that our ancestors used, then transitioned to currency with cowrie shells (yaani at some point that was the height of innovation. Enyewe tumetoka furthest). It made it’s way to coin and paper currency which is predominantly what we use. But sasa ata stuff imekuwa digital. To be honest salo yangu inaendanga kama sijashika doh yoyote na mkono. Kwanza with iBANK na KCB Credit and Debit card, sijawai pata need ya kuspend physical money. Life is easier now.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Lakini, with the evolution of money comes with the evolution of the best practices around it. Kwanza as much as tumesema kuspend doh nowadays ni more convenient na hizi digital channels, tunaneed sana ku ensure we don’t spend it all in one place. Hii economy haicheki na mtu, and we need to survive with what we have. Hii mambo ya ‘there’s too much month at the end of my salary’ should come to an end. It’s not a flex imagine. You’re huko posting that on social and getting tihihis, shares and comments lakini the people indulging you wamejipanga on their side. Fear Nairobians.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Sa juu tumedecide round this tunaomoka, then we need to act accordingly. Tuko on the road to create financial freedom so where does that start boys and girls? By planning. Imagine hivo tu. Sio ati nini au nini. To get stared on this journey of having our finances in check, lazima tubudget income. Kama ni salo ama uko biz and you pay yourself a certain amount from your proceeds, mwenendo ni ule ule. The word is budgeting. In order to live a debt free life, acquire assets  and live a financially free life, then lazima tufollow hizi steps that will structure our financial life and keep us from spending impulsively.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Budgeting is an ongoing process:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " Sio ati unamake your excel sheet then at the beginning of the month then abandon it until the next month. Zii. Revisit your plan weekly ndio ucheki if you’re actually keeping to it. Analyze your plan na kama it is working, kama haiwork then make necessary adjustments. Make additions, remove aspects that don’t work. Kumbuka, it has to be practical otherwise it won’t work for you. Stay in touch with your plans and income.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Use the 50, 20, 30 rule:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " Kuna financial geniuses walikaa down and from their analysis of economics and how finances work, they saw that allocating 50% of your income to your needs, 20% to your savings and debt and 30% to miscellaneous is the best way to ensure doh zako zinatumika vipractical. So half of kile inaingia should go to what you need to survive: food, clothing, shelter and transport. Yes, transii iko kwa hiyo category sasa. You need to be mobile. Utaenda job aje bila transport?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "20% inafaa kusort deni then kila inabaki usave. From hii bucket ndo mi husort Wafula na Sospeter zile doh wameniokolea nazo the previous month. Pia kuna sacco nakuwanga member. Progressive thinking msee. Saa zingine nitaget kaloan kadogo kusort tuprojects hapa kule. When it comes to paying back, natoanga kwa hii bucket ya 20%. Na kama you’re God’s favorite child na ata hujui deni hukaa aje, then the whole 20% can go into savings. Si heri wewe. Anyway, no time for being salty. Moving on swiftly.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Sasa kuna hiyo 30% imebaki. Sio ati kila saa ni vitu serious. Si wanasemanga all work and no play makes Sospeter a dull boy? Haya. We then had to make room for sherehe. Tunaziita miscellaneous, entertainment and whatever thy heart desireth. (wacha niongee kiShakespeare ata ndio ujue we’re letting loose). Hapa sasa ni hizo roadtrips, kina Naxvegas, Vasha tings, Kina WRC. This is the allocation for it. It’s allowed to nip from this bucket. Lakini, sio ati sasa ikuw msee wa sherehe 24/7. Saa zingine chill. Feel free to not take from the entire pot. You can bakshish some mulla from this allocation and put it into your savings.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Zero based budgeting: ", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": "Back to the financial lingo but hear me out, the concept is easy as pie. After the budgeting and allocation of funds to their various buckets, you should come to a base of zero. No negatives. That would mean unaspend doh hauna. Na pia if there is any surplus, it means huja allocate do yote yenye inakam through. Basically, tunasema the math should be mathing. Don’t spend beyond your means and don’t squeeze any bucket.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Na hayo machache, si you can now Go Ahead and prosper? Follow these simple rules na utakuwa fiti. You’ll be ahead of the game. Fo’ sho’.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Over&Out,", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Witty Banker", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "10.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "To be honest salo yangu inaendanga kama sijashika doh yoyote na mkono. {"seo": [], "title": "The Safari Rally. An Enduring Icon of Roaring Entertainment", "years": ["2022"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q3"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-07-2022", "article_text": [{"type": "heading", "attrs": {"level": 2, "textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "KASARANI", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Thursday, 23", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": "rd", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}, {"type": "superscript"}]}, {"text": " June 2022.", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "I find Wango near the arc where Nkrumah Avenue joins Moi Avenue, at the ATMs on KenCom House. The 70s-style, beige-coloured building, is one of Nairobi's most distinct landmarks is KCB's headquaters. Wango is dressed exactly how you'd imagine a free-thinking artiste from Nairobi would be fitted out. A flowery shirt, black jeans, a grey knit cap that bulges from the size of his locs and comfortable rubber shoes. On his wrist, he has a large red-and-white wristlet that makes the Kenyan bracelet next to it look like it follows the dietary advice of Amerix.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The full \"I-am-a-freelance-Nairobi-artist\" aesthetic.", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}, {"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "He's a talented sketch artist who is as interesting as he is soft-spoken. The kind of person you'd forget you were in a room with because they spend more time observing and scribbling things rather than talking.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "There's a branded van in the parking lot waiting for us from KCB, the official financial partner of the WRC Safari Rally and overall sports enthusiasts. We're headed to Kasarani to cover day one of the WRC Safari Rally, one of Kenya's most iconic national events, revered like national holidays and election would be. First organised in 1953, The Safari Rally was held to commemorate the Queen's coronation. Back when there were no ATMs, widespread credit cards, and definitely no mobile banking. Founded in 1896, KCB already had 57 years of banking experience when the rally started. 1,2,3,10,20,40..57. That was already five decades of valuable lessons, and since then it’s been a long, storied route towards perfecting how to bank Kenyans.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Then, as it is now, The Safari Rally route was as scenic as it was brutal. Picturesque little towns in Uganda, Kenya and Tanzania. Empty villages with smoke billowing from huts one day and bustling metropolises the next. A punishing route for the drivers and a pleasant rush of thrill for the thousands, possibly millions, of onlookers. A yearly routine of human against machine, time, dust and mud...until 2002.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This year's rally is only the second installment after an 18-year hiatus, and the turnout on the streets and social media shows how much Kenyans had missed the rally. Their rally. Their yearly break from monotony. A chance for thousands of little children to wave tiny flags and have others painted with their cheeks painted while their parents wave and point their camera phones at speeding cars.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Patriotism Cabinet Secretary, if we had one, would be pleased with this stuff.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Inside the van and away from Nairobi's punishing June sun, we must now deal with her infamous lunch-hour traffic. Thika Road, the city's busiest and biggest road, is clogged. There are crowds lined up to the safety barriers, with baton-wielding police keeping the enthusiastic fans away from the rally cars. VIPs, closed roads, and an excited population are the perfect ingredients for turn-off-your-engine traffic. Now, a journey which normally takes twenty minutes takes us an hour. Inside the van, we talk shop, about cars, and the art scene in Nairobi, the things people talk about to pass time.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "At ground zero, Safari Rally is electric.", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}, {"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It's so loud that it's hard to have a conversation, there's the din of numerous people shouting, a chopper overhead every two minutes, and cars revving around us. I motion to Wango that we should head as close to the rally cars as the police will let us. It's a recently-dug track, and the soil, the colour of freshly-peeled beetroot, flies into your face if you're close enough to get an Instagram-worthy picture. There are many selfies and government and corporate suits with shoes caked in dust. Who probably couldn't turn down the opportunity to take a break from work, relive their childhoods, or see first-hand what their parents are always reminiscing about?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "After we take enough pictures for Wango to sketch from, we head to the KCB hospitality tent. As expected, there's extra security, men and women in suits and uniforms, dark goggles and mild frowns. The bouncer at the gate has arms so big I wonder how he satisfies an itch in his ear. We show him our badges, he pats our bags and pockets for weapons or illegalities, and then we slip into the tent.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Inside, there are tables full of delicious-looking food in the catering tent, and there's no mean-looking chef at the chafing dish containing chicken. I tell Wango that I think that KCB really loves us because there are even tiny dessert cakes with frosting and cherries on them, and again, there is no chef to limit the number of cakes on your plate. If I am honest with myself, this is the real reason I went to writing school, to enjoy unsupervised buffet spreads and eat their contents to the sounds of choppers overhead.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Wango in his element", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}, {"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A spot frees up, and we sit down. The tent is busy. Waiters are balancing food and drinks on trays, the click-click sounds of photographers taking shots, the laughter of new and old friends catching up over a view of Kasarani's apartment-dotted skyline. Rally cars speed in the foreground as 'Amapiano' plays from the mounted speakers. This will be one of the few times in our lives that we'll have a five-star meal, with choppers overhead and speeding cars in the distance.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Away from the food, and music, there's excitement in the air. The phones in hand. The smiles on people's faces. The country needed this break, a positive distraction from the fast-paced lives that modern-day Kenya demands.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "We eat slowly, enjoying the sights, rally drivers flattening their gas pedals to save precious seconds, photographers scrambling to get shots that will please their editors. Onlookers, their mouths looking like black and pink-lined Os, marvelling at the speed and skills on display. The people who signed the Ksh 100 million cheque to the WRC would be extremely proud of this sight.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Safari Rally is a national pastime. Building A Winning Team, One Rally At A Time", "years": ["2022"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q3"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Thu-07-2022", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Written by:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Victor Karuga, Founder – ", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": "Little Grey Notepad", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "link", "attrs": {"rel": null, "href": "https://littlegreynotepad.co.ke/", "title": null, "target": null}}, {"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "There are flower pots along the outside courtyard at Java Junction Mall. Medium-sized vases with green flowers in them. They remind me of vineyards I read about on old, tattered wine books that had too many words and not enough pictures for a ten-year-old.  I’m here early because Evans Kavisi, seasoned architect, and autodidact rally driver, is both as knowledgeable and interesting as a white-haired sage, and more people than attended the rally and followed #FeelTheRoar on socials need to know about him.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Alfred Wango's", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "link", "attrs": {"rel": "noopener noreferrer", "href": "https://www.instagram.com/stories/highlights/18009998122052642/", "title": "Alfred Wango's", "target": "_blank"}}]}, {"text": " illustration of ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "Evans", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "link", "attrs": {"rel": "noopener noreferrer", "href": "https://www.instagram.com/evans_kavisi_racing/", "title": "Evans", "target": "_blank"}}]}, {"text": " and Absalom. The two most prominent members of the team.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A few days back, about 95 kilometres away from Nairobi’s coffeehouses, he was roaring into the dusty plains of Soysambu and Kedong’, deep inside Kenya’s expansive Rift Valley, harnessed into a bucket seat that is as secure as the over 400-year-old documents in the ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "Vatican Street Archive", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "link", "attrs": {"rel": null, "href": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vatican_Secret_Archives", "title": null, "target": null}}]}, {"text": " in Rome.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "To the thousands of spectators on-site, local or foreign, phones in hand, and anticipation on their faces, he was a source of fascination, pride, thrill, patriotism even. A young man (only 35), self taught, and now taking on a sport steeped in awe and nostalgia in Kenya. Navigating steep corners and lengthy stretches at speeds that are illegal on all roads except the ones he and his competitors are allowed to use, all while wearing fire-retardant suits because of how risky the sport can get.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "His story reminded me about the farming process for grapes in dry areas. Essentially, grapes whose roots must work harder than watered ones produce grapes with more flavour and character. He’s had to have a laser-like focus and sacrifice on rallying to get front-page spreads, just like merlots or pinot noirs in parched soils have to dig deep to earn their character. The farming process starts with harvesting, then crushing and pressing, followed by fermentation, leading to clarification, and finally aging and bottling. Evans, like an award-winning vintage, has gone through all the processes.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "HARVESTING", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In the early 90s, the version of the Safari Rally that spectators enjoyed then was very different than the one on display now. Cars would race across bustling towns, sleepy little villages, and deserted highways across Kenya, Uganda, and Tanzania.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "That’s how a young Evans got his first sighting of a sport that would consume, and affect, every aspect of his life. A driver’s car broke down in front of him in his village in Matuu, Eastern Kenya and he got to watch the entire team, chopper included, fixing the car. It probably helped that it wasn’t the Instagram era, and he watched instead of recording.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "He watched on, and after he had raced home (pun intended), after what to most people would have been just another amazing moment, it got him so excited that he spent three days in hospital fighting a full-on panic attack, (complete with muscle spasms and temporarily losing the ability to talk). Later, in boarding school in primary, he would read the back pages just to get rally news and clippings, and his love for rally racing was born. A sticker, and a story at a time.   ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "CRUSHING AND PRESSING", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Life is a series of events and decisions. Events and decisions that make us laugh, cry, curl up in numbing pain, recoil in shock and hurt, and experience a whole range of contrasting emotions. Most of them, up to adulthood, are made for us. Then we must make the decisions that will define where we will end up.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "After high school at Moi Forces Academy, he knocked on as many doors as possible, so he could add to what he had learned in the news and clippings about rallying.  His refusal to take no for an answer found him at Azar Anwar’s garage along Ngong Road, and it remains hallowed grounds to date, going by the reverent way he speaks of it. A garage that he sought out himself, and made his home.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A noisy, oily, and busy home. Where he learned, and honed his craft, during his days at JKUAT (Jomo Kenyatta University Of Agriculture and Technology). While studying what was a demanding course in architecture, weekends were even more punishing, financially, mentally, and physically. Learn about pastiches (imitating the style of other creators) in class over the weekday, and scrutineering (ensuring compliance with regulations) over the weekend. The little money he could spare was channelled into learning as much as he could, theoretically and practically, all he could about rallying and all that it entailed.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "FERMENTATION", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The lessons from Anwars’s garage, and the networks created there were essential to understanding the physical and mental discipline needed to race at a high level; tight schedules meant little, or no time for nights out, alcohol, and distractions away from the end goal; getting rally-ready.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "All these sacrifices were done at no compensation and even out of pocket most times. I ask him how essential KCB’s support has for the growth of motorsport in the country, “As much as they are sponsoring, they also do the marketing side of things” he says appreciatively.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Having a budget to build hype in addition to sponsoring the team, ensures there’s a limelight on the sport and the drivers, which gets more people on the racetracks, attracts more corporates, grows the sport and the healthy cycle continues. Everyone is happy, the drivers, the enthusiasts, and the sponsors.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "He adds that KCB understands motorsport, and that has to do with the fact they have already sunk a staggering Ksh 1.2 billion into motorsport in only 19 years (a separate investment has been made in football, rugby, golf, and volleyball). To savour the sweet aftertaste of an impressive showing and finish, there’s a preparation that is needed in motorsport that can only be achieved when sponsorship is achieved in time.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“KCB came in in March, which enabled me to complete my tests in good time”, he says. Testing for the WRC is strict, and to pass scrutineering, there’s a long list of things that need to be checked off; vehicle, driver and codriver safety, seat mould specifications, helmet, suit and tire standards. He add that “It’s a rigorous, expensive process and the presence of a partner that understands the fine parts of the business, and not just having their brand on my car is important”. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "CLARIFICATION  (FILTERING)", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Finding partners that understand that rally is a big, and special part of his life is important. His eyes light up every time he talks about his crew, a twenty-person team that involves logistics, mechanics, finance, reconnaissance, and co-driving. Yet, to most of the public, an unseen, yet crucial part of his success. He speaks about his team like a proud parent would about a well-behaved, responsible child.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“Taking entire engines apart to find out why a gear function is slow or unresponsive, and sacrificing sleep while at it, is something my team has done routinely”, he says. That’s in addition to the hours spent at the training range, the service bay, and as support in case they are needed. That’s passion and dedication. To the team and the sport. There’s a lot of discipline needed in the sport, and Evans says it rubs off into daily life. Having tunnel vision. Being obsessed with the goal, but being flexible with the route to achieving it. Ingredients for a race he and his team would be proud of, and also for a full life with as few regrets as possible.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "AGING AND BOTTLING", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Evans and his team, (he’s very particular about not doing it alone) have done 19 races in Kenya and Tanzania, and they’re just getting warmed up, (pun intended). Racing in Dakar, which would involve a step up in levels of logistics, preparations and machinery is a dream that remains alive, as is hopefully having his own school one day. To pay back to the sport what Azar, his team and supporters have given to him. Because even if KCB gave him a blank cheque, it wouldn’t be enough to repay their above-and-beyond passion and dedication, almost bordering on obsession.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Evans during the interview", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "There’s plenty of life lessons to be picked up from Evans and his team. Hard work. Ambition. Discipline. Meticulousness. Loyalty to those we love.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The best wines are good for up to 20 years after they were bottled, proof of their distinction and character. The partnership between Evans and KCB brings only the best to spectators and enthusiasts. A platform for a success story to be heard and seen, on the biggest of stages by a bank that exists to make a difference, across sports, industries and countries.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "10.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "There are flower pots along the outside courtyard at Java Junction Mall. Medium-sized vases with green flowers in them. They remind me of vineyards I read about on old, tattered wine books that had too many words and not enough pictures for a ten-year-old.", "blog_categories": ["sports"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "12-banner.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "You’re Not Sad, Ni Deni Inakusumbua, Beloved…", "years": ["2022"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Wed-05-2022", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A lot of things age like milk! Like how you plan and swear by the switch ups you’ll make in your finances without being intentional… alafu sasa ongezea zile madeni uko nazo.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "You’re probably in this sitch; and have been in it for so long ata you don’t remember the last time you REALLY looked forward to pay day. I said REALLY the way I did coz you still do but only for your peace of mind; and so that wenye wanakudai stop blowing up your phone with calls and SMSs. Kuna wenye huenda that extra step to call your friends and family so you’re constantly on edge… ugh the mess of it all jamani!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "And so, the relief of keeping those off for 3-4 weeks feels like heaven, right?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "But imagine, if you quieted them for good, soon? Ni possible and I know this firsthand.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The first step, I’ve found, to getting out of this cycle is to love yourself enough to want lasting peace for you. Kuna makasiriko huwezi control the moment you step out of the house… jua au mvua, traffic, rude kanges, noise pollution, the price of things (saa zingine ata humean kubuy kitu, but you see the price on it and your day goes to the dogs because sasa mandazi ni kitu ya kuuzia mtu 30 bob???). Unafika mjei, foreman na mkubwa have a few things to let off their chests, your coworker called in sick, so you have to work double, unajaribu kupigia mtu simu unapata huna airtime yaani…", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "After all that and many other stressors, jioni ukirudi home, you mind deserves rest nani. Si kufunga macho and all you see is -ve numbers. Life is not easy, beloved, but it is NOT supposed to be this hard, like c’mon???", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "So say it with me, “This is the year to get out of bad debt.” (I called it bad debt juu kuna good debt kama mortgages and other long-term goals for which your RM has worked out a plan. However, this could also be bad debt if you’ve not been sticking to the said plan. Are we together?)", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "First, accept that you are in a bad situation. Proceed to affirm that you deserve better – I didn’t make the rules but wallahi tena, the universe has ears. Follow through with a plan by i) understanding different kinds of debt you’re in and ii) making an actionable plan towards getting out of them.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The most common types of debt zenye most of us can relate to ni hizi (Again, naongelea personal experience and what I know (could make sense to a lot of you too)):", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "bulletList", "content": [{"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Secured debt", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " – hizi huwa na collateral. So tuseme you secure a loan then unahitajika kulist gari yako or some other high value asset incase ughost bank wakujie. But si ni life? Usually, these kinds of debt huwa guided by an RM… well, at least that’s how the bank that loves you (us guys) does it. If your bank imekuwachilia mkono ukafigure out kivyako, it’s time to leave, beloved. Seriously though, this is not the kind of thing you go at solo. Also, stop leaving in fear, no bank will nini you for asking for a game plan – if anything, it is your right. A bank gives you money na roho safi sana; wanting you to prosper. No bank or reputable financial institution wants you to not get them back… or to fail. Notice the emphasis on the last sentence. Maneno ya shylocks mimi siezi ongelea… ogopa sana hao watu coz what the what???", "type": "text"}]}]}, {"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Unsecured debt", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " – hapa ndio nduru iko. Because in this our Kenya today, hizi loans unaeza access from multiple creditors and these are the ones that get you in mad beef coz you get into a cycle. Unachukua KCB M-PESA bila plan, due date ikikaribia unarukia ile ingine inarhyme na Yala ndio ulipe KCB M-PESA. Na kama loan limit yako Yala haifiki bei, unaongeza the other one that’s a ‘part of a tree’. Short term solutions that never end. Kumbuka hapa pia you’ve not factored in things like interest rates for the other loans you’ve taken. Interest rate ya KCB M-PESA is the lowest in the market at kitu 7.5%. Ya ‘Yala’ ni anywhere between 11.4% or 15.2% na ya ‘part of a tree’ is between 13% -23%. Call yourself for a meeting and ask yourself some tough questions. Would you rather slightly delay that KCB M-PESA repayment and get charged a small lateness fee ama apply for loans going up to 40%???", "type": "text"}]}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Shida huwa looking for an easy way out bila a strategy. And it’s kind of weird to do the same thing over and over then expect different results, innit?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Kumbuka pia KCB M-PESA wakikucall following up on a late payment, unawapea tu a date yenye uko sure utalipa. They also don’t enjoy bombarding you with phonecalls. This should also go for the ‘Yala’s and them. So you commit to a date and you swallow that chunky pill of gall one time.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The next time you want to take out a loan, jiulize mawili matatu about why you are taking the loan. Do you REALLY need it? Can you push whatever it is hadi ulipwe? Are you ready kulipa interest on small small loans, really? If you do decide to take it, utarudisha by the due date? Unapanga kulipa aje.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "When you ask yourself these questions as your shoes kuenda local, utajipata tu umerudi kwa keja because what makes cents, makes sense and it has been accorded to each one of us abundantly. You’ll find that FOMO hapa na pale will translate into financial wins for you!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Tufanye hii kwanza and I’ll be back to drop more gems on all things debt. Meanwhile, we’re doing a  whole thing called ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "Why Don’t We Know This", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "link", "attrs": {"rel": null, "href": "https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLHQda196tCzIH9Jrbdr_LZ14LWb8wnCpZ", "title": null, "target": null}}]}, {"text": " (about money manenos). Jipange because this year ni kusema na kutenda: WE ARE GETTING OUR FINANCES IN CHECK, m’kay? Good.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Over&Out,", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Witty Banker", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "14-featured.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "You’re probably in this sitch; and have been in it for so long ata you don’t remember the last time you REALLY looked forward to pay day. But today let’s talk about debt planning. Yes, ata deni lazime uchukue ukiwa umeji-sort ndio isikuwe ngori down the line…", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Heard of debt management tools? Imagine the good internet has an array of tools to make your life a bit easier when it comes to this? Just google debt management tools and voila! Anweis, why are these tools important? The event will be held under the theme – “Africa Unleashed: Navigating Disruptions, Enhancing Opportunities”.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Under Russo's leadership, KCB Group has continued to scale new heights, with a commitment to innovation, sustainability, and driving socio-economic development across the region. {"seo": [], "title": "Some Tips to Help You During This Covid Time", "years": ["2020"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Thu-05-2020", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Wollap guys, I hope you’re all doing well. Kwanza that ka boys’ trip we had planned later this year with Sospeter and Wafula… Makasiriko tu.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Despite the circumstances, I’ve been trying to stay positive msee and I think you should too. Na look forward to when all this is over. We may or may not be close to the end of COVID but that hasn’t stopped me from thinking ‘alafu’.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Those who still have their jobs should count themselves lucky. So niko na mawaidha kadhaa.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "orderedList", "attrs": {"start": 1}, "content": [{"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Clear your debts:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "You might be looking at that deni you have that is in the thousands and wondering if you will ever maliza it. Wanasemanga haba na haba…", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "orderedList", "attrs": {"start": 2}, "content": [{"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Draw up a budget:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Wacha niwaambie vile nilikuwa nikispend when I got my first stable job! Hiyo pesa, I look back and wish I had done things of maana with it. Sahii ningekuwa mbali J But you know when you’ve been broke for a while alafu uguze pesa, issa wrap! What has saved me is budgeting. Allocate different sums of your chums for different needs and wants. You can still have enjoyment when you create a sustainable entertainment budget too, so usijifungie sana. But don’t just spend money bila mpango when it comes, coz you’ll have a very hard time accounting where it all went when that bank account reads zero (just ask me).", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "orderedList", "attrs": {"start": 3}, "content": [{"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Save:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "I cannot stress this enough. If there’s a time you should be saving, it’s now. Your spending expenses are less if you’re working from home, so take advantage of this opportunity. Rainy days are unpredictable given the current sitch and we know you want to be orait in case things go left, sindio? ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "orderedList", "attrs": {"start": 4}, "content": [{"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Declutter:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "And I mean this in terms of everything that serves you no purpose anymore (wueh, mnipee cheo ya motivational speaker sasa). So we best be prepared au sio?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Over&Out,", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Witty Banker.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "covid-times-tips-1726747349.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Wollap guys, I hope you’re all doing well.
