{"seo": [], "title": "Coping With the Ongoing Covid19 Pandemic", "years": ["2020"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-04-2020", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Guys I hope you’ve been good since last week. This week has been a particularly dull one for me. Last week kulikiwa na madrama but this week has been a quiet one-ish. It’s good to see watu wametulia kiasi after the previous shenanigans I saw on these Twitter streets.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Being home all day without the freedom to go on abut with your normal life is a bust. Do you find yourself glued to your phone looking at the latest news ama ni mimi tu? I’ve read article after article about COVID19 and there is no end in sight. Anxiety levels for a lot of people I’m sure zinapanda daily. I know mine are for sure. So how are some of the ways ya’ll are dealing with it all?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Let me share my experience. Eh, thank God we are living in this era of social media coz enyewe it has been my saving grace in keeping me from dying from extreme boredom. I am entertained DAILY by the things I see when I log onto my twirra and IG. Guys, keep the challenges coming. People have been extra creative these past few weeks for real J", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "I’ve also been really learning to appreciate the small things. Najua ni hard, given the situation. I’ve been complaining, na najua pia nyinyi mna makasiriko. You can’t go dunda, you can’t mingle and see your friends or famo, some of us tumelose majob, it’s hard to be grateful, but trust me, there is always something to be grateful for. Watu wa ‘bora uhai’ are we together?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Sospeter aliniwozzap call juzi and we had a long chat reassuring each other. Call your people, it goes a long way for both of you. Check up on that pal who lives solo, tunateseka my fren, let me not lie to you. Call that your elderly neighbor who might need your help kufanya shopping. Throw a bash online with your peeps (I don’t think this hasn’t been done a couple of times already lol). ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Also, I’ve not been putting pressure on myself to accomplish a million things. Yes, we have a bit more time to do things we usually wouldn’t be able to with a busy work week, but don’t feel guilty if you come out of this still not knowing how to bake J haha. Taking care of your health mentally, emotionally and physically should be your top priority.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Anywei wasee, I’m hopeful. I really am. I hope when we get out of this terrible experience we’ll get out as better people, as better friends, better sons, daughters, huzzies, wives, you name it. Msilose hope. All those plans you had for the year, hold on to that. Make more. Mimi  have a list of all the things I’m dying to do when all this is over. It keeps you going. Na wale watu wa Ruaka wenye bado wanathrow ma house party, wacheni, priss?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Over and Out,", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Witty Banker.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "coping-with-covid19-1726749853.png", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Guys I hope you’ve been good since last week. This week has been a particularly dull one for me. Last week kulikiwa na madrama but this week has been a quiet one-ish.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "coping-with-covid19.png", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Proper Safety COVID19 Precautions We Need To Take Seriously", "years": ["2020"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-04-2020", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "These past few days have had a lot of LOL moments aki. I know social distancing inatupeleka mbio but surely sisi Wakenya nini huwa inatusumbua? The things I have seen and the stories I have been reading online…", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Let me not even go far. Let’s give it up to the OG’s of breaking the social distancing rules; wale walipanda ambulance with the hopes of being taken to sijui which house party.  I have so many questions. Kwanza, why are you having a house party now OF ALL TIMES??? Ilikuwa a must? Also, what part of ‘emergency’ don’t ya’ll understand? Coz last I checked ambulances are used for emergencies. Aki ni kama watu hawajipendi. As much as it’s hilarious it is also not the smartest thing as far as people complying to the curfew rules that have been put in place. Nitawapee innovation 10 out of 10 but… Heh.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Alafu nimeona squad kadhaa pale Ngong Hills, ni kama it was a parking lot, over the long weekend. My friends, social distancing doesn’t mean we all go to the park and park our cars 1.5 meters apart then come together and chill. No, that’s not the meaning guyssss! Inamaanisha make nyumbani and refrain from seeing each other. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Now is not the time to go over to your boy’s place kubangaiz na kuchapa story. Si niliwashow how Wozzap Calls is the best way to communicate with your people. Mimi na kina Sospeter and Wafula are also struggling just like you believe me. We are trying as much as possible to stay put and we also literally have made a list of all the thing we will do once all this is over and we return to some normalcy.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Then comes the mask situation. Sidebar, it’s really interesting all the different designs of masks we have out there. Ya’ll are really not slacking on business opportunities, designing these masks; shallap to all the innovative youth making these at home. Anyweiii I have digressed. What I was driving at was proper use of your mask. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "You have purchased one, great. You are wearing it around your neck or not covering your nose and mouth (as intended), not so great. It beats the purpose of wearing it at all, given that the rona (nimeone watu Instagram wanaiita hivi nowadays) is also transmitted airborne. Please let’s wear our masks properly, covering BOTH our nose and mouth. Also dispose of it immediately and if you have a reusable one, wash it thoroughly. Are we together?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Issa struggle. For all of us. Cabin fever imekick in for sure, some of us are taiyaddd of seeing the same faces all day erryday, frustrated at not being able to socialize and live your everyday life. Heh and another shallap to the parents who have to home school their children; from the stories I have heard from some of my friends ya’ll need extra prayers J. Teachers really do deserve more credit than they get for real.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "As we get into the weekend let’s not forget to be grateful. We might be in the worst situation at this moment lakini take a look at your blessings and reflect. Kwa nyumba yako, pekee yako LOL, not at a gathering with your mbogi.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Tusiwekelee stress on our police who are just doing their job by making sure Kenyans are home by 7pm, or the nurses and doctors who are treating the coronavirus cases which are increasing by the day. All these people fighting this disease are getting overwhelmed slowly and all you’re being asked to do is #stayhome so let’s do better my people.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Over&Out,The Witty Banker", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "safety-covid19-precautions-1726750003.png", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "These past few days have had a lot of LOL moments aki. I know social distancing inatupeleka mbio but surely sisi Wakenya nini huwa inatusumbua? The things I have seen and the stories I have been reading online…", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "safety-covid19-precautions.png", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "How to Take Care of Your Mental Health During COVID19", "years": ["2020"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Tue-04-2020", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Taking care of your mental health during COVID19 is so important", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Is it too soon to pour my heart out about how I’m missing kina Sospeter and Wafula ama nikanyagie tu hiyo story? Ei bana don’t judge; it’s 2020, we should have all said a much needed goodbye to masculine toxicity by now fellaz. Heh, people anyweiii, I need strength. But truth is, we all do at this time.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A lot of us are on week three of working from home; week three of not seeing much of our colleagues and friends; week three of not seeing a lot of our family and loved ones; week three of not being able to move about freely. Even worse some of us are trying to beat this disease on the frontline; some are suffering from it and sadly, some have lost their loved ones because of it. So yes people. We need strength.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Those like me who live alone and are single (Mungu saidia!) kwanza! Wacha tu. We shall overcome. Lakini for real people, we will get through this. This weekend is especially going to be a tough one; it being Easter and all. Aki this holiday had totally slipped my mind until a colleague mentioned it then I kumbukad ati kuna aka holiday. Doesn’t feel like it TBH.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Kwanza vile I had plans to tanga this our Kenya over Easter. And I know I’m not the only one. We all had plans; whether it was to take a much needed break from jobo and travel ama just spending time with the fam… But seeing as we will be spending the holidays indoors we might as well make the most out of it.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Technology is your best friend right now. You can order almost anything straight to your doorstep so bado unaweza kuwa na feast kama wewe ni mzembe kupika kama mimi. And most importantly you can still parte after parte online thanks to video calls and other online platforms. So if it’s fam you want to see, there you have it.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Najua niko na mawaidha mingi leo but what I’m trying to drive at is your mental health. It’s just as important as that your physical health you’re trying to maintain by staying indoors. It won’t be easy but there are ways you can ease this pressure off yourself. Keeping close contact with your wapendwas will be key during this time. And thanks to technology this will be a bit of a breeze until this all settles down.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It’s just a matter of when. This ting we are going through none of us have ever experienced so we are all just learning to cope as we go by. Huko solo. So until then, sit tight. And priss Kenyans, let’s just follow instructions. Najua ni hard, (kwanza that curfew; yenyewe for some people it’s genuinely hard to beat it given their jobs and limitation of transport) but let’s just try and comply, long as it will take for us to zoea things. Tusikuwe vichwa ngumu.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Wacha I end this with an inspirational trend I saw on these Twitter streets a few days ago; “Together we stand”. Okay I changed it from #WeStandWithKenyans lakini I believe the point has been driven home sindio J?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Over and out, The Witty Banker", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "mental-health-during-covid19-1726750149.png", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Taking care of your mental health during COVID19 is so important", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "mental-health-during-covid19.png", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Saving During Troubled Times", "years": ["2020"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Mon-04-2020", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Watu wangu, how are ya’ll holding up? I hope mumeanza kuzoea kukaa kwa hao and those of us who live for enjoyment I believe mmetulia sasa. I mean, what choice do we have anyway, with the 7pm curfew… I feel like I have back tracked back to my childhood days pale kwa esto, home by 7pm or I would feel my mother’s wrath. Ni hard, I know, but priss let’s just comply?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Aaaaanywei, for me, last week was a bit frustrating but now I’m realizing this working from home thing ain’t too bad (check in with me in a week or so, my feelings might change lol). I mean, no early mornings (heh, how glad am I that I don’t have to get up early to be stuck in a jav in traffic for an eternity), you have so much flexibility, and the best part of it all, you’re not spending any money.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Ebu think of your monthly expenses when it comes to commuting to work; mimi sijui fuel struggles but my bus fare pia si kidogo. Kwanza those times I feel like spoiling myself by taking a SWVL… And then since we are bachelors and hardly ever cook; also, because at what time?;  breakfast na lunch lazima tubuy like almost every day. Haya, then the weekend comes and since Sospeter, Wafula and myself have to udaku over the week’s events, lazima tupatane weekend. That’s more money spent.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "So guys, during this quarantine period think of all the money you can save over the next few weeks. Since you’re definitely not going out for parte after parte or to enjoy a meal, you can cook more often instead, or learn to. You have all the time in the world to try recipes anyway. Msichome nyumba lakini. You’re also saving your transport money coz you literally can’t move about as much.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Weka weka your chums aside for a rainy day. Or save pole pole for that thing you’ve always been wanting to get yourself on your KCB MPESA. Kwanza now with KCB’s internet banking you can easily keep track of your finances without stressing about trips to the bank.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This year nilimake a promise to myself. Lazima nipande ndege. That is, if things will be back to normal completely over the months. We are planning a boys’ vacay with Sospeter and Wafula na ata tukona open slots so kama mnataka kujoin let us know J I know this is when it’s most important to save and save I will and you should too. Tulifungua Goal Account so by the time we plan our trip later in the year, we’ll be sorted. We don’t know how the next couple of months will play out and it’s good for you to start preparing for anything while you still can.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Also, I’m low key happy that I don’t get to leave the house as much. Shenanigans with the crew were a bit too much and I’m glad we’re taking a much needed break from each other.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Guys, continue taking care of yourselves and your loved ones. Take this time to work on yourself and your future, also financially. Tuko pamoja in this. And let’s not forget about those dealing with this either directly or indirectly… Ni hayo tu kwa sasa.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Over&Out,", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Witty Banker", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "savings-1726750413.png", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Watu wangu, how are ya’ll holding up? I hope mumeanza kuzoea kukaa kwa hao and those of us who live for enjoyment I believe mmetulia sasa.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "savings.png", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Priss, Let’s Remember to Keep Healthy Even as We Stay Home…", "years": ["2020"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Thu-04-2020", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Heh, wasee juzi nilikuwa nimeenda City Market kununua nyama nikapita ule msee wetu wa kujipima weight. My mind flashed back to how I’ve been chilling at home tu nikikula during this quarantine. My movement has been very limited over these past few weeks so I couldn’t resist. Woi, ningempita tu.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Najua nimekuwa nikitaka kunona kiasi coz this my small body apana. Guys, be careful what you wish for. It had been a minute since I last weighed myself and the results two days ago were a wow. Let’s just say I got what I wanted. On that note guys, how many of you are keeping fit? Really?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It’s so easy kujipata umekaa the whole day binge watching your fav series and snacking all day. Sidebar, I really need to stop including lots of junk in my shopping coz nimekuwa nikikula vibaya these past few weeks. It will be hard but nitamek. Otherwise nitakuwa obese by the end of this lockdown.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "As I was scrolling down my Insta feed minding my business (and snacking J) nikaona one of our rugby players lifting a gearbox ni kama ilikuwa karatasi. I’m sure ya’ll have seen other fitness challenges making rounds all over social media. People are really trying to keep busy on these social media streets huh.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Anyhu, me being that person mwenye huingia gym kuuliza subscription ya month ni pesa ngapi (najua tuko wengi msee, don’t lie J) then I ghost, I cannot attempt some of these things. Hii maisha ni lazima you know when to stick to your lane. But it’s important to keep fit and stay healthy during this time. It’s also importanter to know what works for you and what doesn’t.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Since hatuwezi enda gym (happy on the inside), something as simple was walking around your esto can go a long way. Also, how many free apps are there on your play store for at home exercises? Mob sana. I’m downloading one as I write this.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The most importantest in all this is diet, me thinks. You’ll make very little progress in your fitness journey kama unakimbia daily na bado unakula vitu unhealthy. I am not a fitness guru or nutritionist but I think this one is pretty obvious. I will start with myself, by limiting the amount of junk food I stock up on kwa hao and those tempting Jumia deliveries when I’m feeling too lazy to cook. Of course cheat days lazima. It’s a work in progress. Don’t be too hard on yourself pia.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "As we continue staying indoors most of the time let’s not nona out of control. Your bodies will thank you when all this is over. Tujaribu tu. We will rely on you influencers out there to continue giving us motisha!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Over&Out,", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Witty Banker.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "keeping-healthy-1726750735.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Heh, wasee juzi nilikuwa nimeenda City Market kununua nyama nikapita ule msee wetu wa kujipima weight.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "keeping-healthy.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Of Mid-Week Shenanigans and Love In The City.", "years": ["2020"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q1"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Tue-03-2020", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Watu nguyaz, this week tulijua hatujui. Aki Wafula alituharibia CV and I am just hoping word isn’t going around these small streets of Nairobi because if so he will definitely be single forever. This is how it all went down.", "type": "text"}, {"type": "hardBreak"}, {"text": "The month began at an all time high for us, lakini wah. Ngojeni story. It was amazing to say the least.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Tulirudi Nairobi hiyo same day albeit late into the night and believe it or not Monday we were all in the office. This is where it all went downhill.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Midweek shenanigans are the worst. I was famished and didn’t bother waiting for the rest to get there. I know them too well. I would have dropped dead coz of hunger and went ahead to place my order.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "After almost an HOUR Wafula showed up. But nooooo, he was not alone. He walked in with three ladies, very good looking, I must say. After brief introductions we all got to ordering. I was low key hoping that Wafula had enough cash to cater to his guests coz mimi I just thought it was a guys’ evening out and had enough cash for just myself. Sikupewa memo.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "We had a great time as we recalled how fun our road trip to Macha for the game on Sunday was and also started making plans to go to Wafula’s shagz in Bungoma. Sikuwa nataka aibu ndogo ndogo.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It was getting late and it was time to leave. To avoid awkwardness and embarazzment that would follow us for weeks to come (ata kama tumezoea hizi vitu), I took out my KCB debit card and handled the bill. After all you’re not charged when you use your card. Heh! Wafula atajua atanilipa kutoka wapi coz…", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "When Sospeter heard of our escapedes for the night he was glad that work saved him that day. And now that this very short month is coming to a close we hope you are as ready as me to tackle the rest of the 10 months.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Me na the mbogi have a lot planned for the month of March. {"seo": [], "title": "KCB KNRC Series 2020 Ndiyo Hiyo!", "years": ["2020"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q1"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Tue-03-2020", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "What a way to start the new(ish) year!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "How’s it coming a long so far? We survived 121 day of Njaanuary and here we are ushering in the month of love! We know you might still be feeling the crunch of Njaanuary so let us treat you in a most exciting hangout that pretty easy on the pocket.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Ngata ni how much? Nimezoea kupanda nduthi na tuktuk so hizi car-owner problems mi huskia na nyinyi. What if we told you… you could fill your tank tupatane Athi River this weekend with your whole crew for a day of motorsport over some yum food and drinks? A pretty easy plan angalao utoke Nairobi this year coz the way things have been set up, most of us tumejua the way every corner of our houses looks because there was zero enjoyment in Jan. Juu mkiwa na pesa nyumba zenu hazikalikangi.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "So here’s the deal. The KNRC series 2020 is nigh and here’s basically what you should know. Where? Athi River. We figured a dusty not-so-out-of-town plan fits just perfect for a Sunday plan, ama? Monday hatutaki makasiriko na wadosi. All rallies we’ve held in the past have been super exciting but what makes this one one of its kind? We’ll have a power stage!!! Napenda kutumia jargon nikae msmart. So let the expert here explain what’s a power stage. That means drivers will have the chance to earn extra points to boost their performance and ranking by introducing an extra stage. NB: Resist the urge to eat it at 11.00.", "type": "text"}]}]}, {"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Kaa nyumbani my fren. (BIG EYE EMOJI) Yes.", "type": "text"}]}]}, {"type": "listItem", "content": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Do you really need that pair of boots you saw IG? {"seo": [], "title": "Enterpreneur finds opportunity in toilets", "years": ["2019"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-12-2019", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "8th Dec, 2015", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Few entrepreneurs would think of investing their money in the management of public toilets. Even fewer would imagine that human waste could be translated into a business idea.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "But to David Kuria, the founder of Iko Toilet, this was a business opportunity idea, which he saw in over seven years ago and is now a cash cow employing in excess of 150 youths and serving 10 million people annually.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In an interview, he says the idea was to transform the thinking on toilet among many people in sub-Saharan Africa where toilet has always been taken as a taboo.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“The idea of Iko Toilet is more of a transformation and really thinking beyond toilet in our region where toilet is treated like a taboo, we needed to open that up and adress the social aspect of a toilet,” he says.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“To us the idea was to address the social aspect of a toilet and make it more beautiful, to me almost like a monument that would make people start changing their thinking to toilet,” he says. “But most importantly we also looked at ways of making toilet a sustainable venture that can be able to give a return on investment.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Iko Toilet is built in the model of a mall where it goes beyond the long and short call functions of any ordinary toilet. The facility has extensions with shoe shiners, M-Pesa agents, and shops where one can buy snacks and soft drinks.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“So this is the only public toilet where you can get in and relieve yourself, buy a snack, send money and shine your shoes, all under one roof. The degree of cleanliness has to be top notch to maintain the hygiene,” says Kuria.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Iko Toilet is probably one of the largest toilet companies in Africa with footprints in Uganda, Tanzania and Liberia. Kuria says his major impact since idea conception is the transformation of a sector previously managed by the public.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "He says he has been able to change lives through the provision of employment to hundreds of youths in a sector that did not exist ten years ago.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“To me it is more of a passion really trying to create some kind of change in what I call disruptive transformation. This is a solution to several problems in Africa that by extension through employment alleviates poverty in the society,” he says.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In 2010, the social entrepreneur received a UN’s international best practice award.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Among his other recognition are the Ashoka Fellowship, dubbed the change makers, which he received in the US in 2007, the Hall of fame – world toilet organization in Singapore 2008, Africa entrepreneur of the year in 2009 and the President Clinton Citation.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Kuria is banking on the Vision 2030 economic blue print and the new Constitution as he spreads his Iko Toilets to counties, which will become urban area under the new order.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "He says he done thorough marketing and the concept has been received well in 20 municipalities across the country. The demand is soaring in emerging towns where people are looking at innovative ways of offering services.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“We are trying to provoke social entrepreneurs in cities such as Kampala, Der es salaam, Lusaka Ghana and Liberia which has simial sanitation problems,” he says.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The company has already piloted ten iko toilets in Kampala, similar model is also in Dar es salaam. through a franchise model.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“So our target is if we can have this idea across sub Saharan Africa but in a model that fits needs of the local. The target is to develop a franchise approach.”", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "opportunity-in-toilets-1726835859.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Few entrepreneurs would think of investing their money in the management of public toilets. {"seo": [], "title": "Corporate social responsibility now a priority", "years": ["2019"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-12-2019", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "27th Jan, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "For many organizations, corporate social responsibility (CSR) was once a purely philanthropic activity to arouse public goodwill with no consequence on profitability.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "However, the perception has changed with CSR programmes ranking high on the corporate plans of most organizations. He says the media now receptive to CSR activities. “When most organizations rolling out substantial CSR projects, journalists thought the activities were publicity stunts but the perception has changed,” he said.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "He noted well planned and executed CSR projects have the power to position a company differently from its competitors. “CSR projects can differentiate a company from its competitors targeting the same market segment,” said Otin. [{"text": "Commissioning the machine, KCB Foundation Chairperson Catherine Kola noted that the donation of the dialysis machine is part of a larger entity in working with communities in curbing diseases.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“Some of the interventions we support include the provision of medical equipment to medical institutions, support of health education programmes and the sponsorship of medical camps especially in low income and marginalized areas,” she said.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "She also added that KCB Foundation has invested over 40 million towards the purchase of dialysis machines to support the 47 counties across Kenya.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Kola said the bank through its CSR arm, the KCB Foundation, is keen in supporting county governments with equipment to enhance quality health care services and programmes.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In an earlier interview, the former Kenya Power and Lighting Chief Executive Joseph Njoroge noted that sustaining CSR projects is an obligation that every organization has because it makes money from the community, so it plough some of the earnings back.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "He noted that other than granting a company the “social "“When you touch people’s lives, you touch their hearts and hope you have recruited new customers and investors. {"seo": [], "title": "KCB signs African Cross-Border Payment deal to support customers", "years": ["2023"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["news"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 15, "article_date": "Fri-06-2023", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "KCB Group has signed an Africa-wide deal to facilitate settlements of cross-border transactions on the continent. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "The agreement signed early this week with the Pan-African Payment and Settlement System (PAPSS) in Accra, Ghana on the sidelines of the Afrexim Bank Annual Meeting, makes KCB the first Bank in East Africa to onboard the financial market infrastructure that provides a secure and efficient channel for processing cross-border payments.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "KCB Group CEO, Paul Russo said this platform will guarantee speed, affordability, and reliability of transactions, effectively boosting intra-African trade and payments.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "“With this agreement, we bring on board our payments and collections expertise spanning over 120 years. This means that our customers will now have access to vast economic opportunities that will deliver multiple advantages and efficiencies especially when conducting Intra-African trade payments.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "The platform is a centralized Financial Market Infrastructure developed in collaboration with the African Export-Import Bank (Afreximbank) to complement trading under the Africa Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA). It provides an alternative to current high-cost and lengthy correspondent banking relationships to facilitate trade and other economic activities among African countries through a simple, low-cost risk-controlled payment clearing and settlement system. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "“As a Pan-African banking institution, it is our desire to play a bigger role in facilitating trade across Africa and beyond. With such partnerships, we shall be able to settle our own transactions including those for all its subsidiaries as well as for other commercial banks without many hurdles.” Russo said.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "The platform will deliver multiple advantages and efficiencies to intra-African trade payments that include a reduction in the duration and time variability of cross-border payments across Africa, support real-time payments, decrease the liquidity requirements of commercial banks for cross-border payments, remove transaction value limits, enable commercial banks to set the applicable exchange rates and strengthen oversight of crossborder payment systems by Central Banks.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "The Pan-African Payment and Settlement System network currently consists of at least 8 Central Banks, 28 commercial banks, and six switches. It has successfully been piloted in the six countries of the West African Monetary Zone and is expected to expand into the five regions of Africa before the end of 2023. Additionally, all African Central Banks are expected to sign up by the end of 2024 while all commercial banks by the end of 2025.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "african-cross-border-deal.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3301", "article_excerpt": "KCB Group has signed an Africa-wide deal to facilitate settlements of cross-border transactions on the continent.", "blog_categories": ["banking"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back To News", "article_banner_image": "news-banner.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Ogier: “The Challenge Of Safari Is Unique\"", "years": ["2023"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["news"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 15, "article_date": "Thu-06-2023", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Sébastien Ogier has reiterated his love for Africa- and most importantly- Kenya's iconic World Rally Championship round.  ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "Relaying his experiences on his ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "RedBull.com", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}, {"text": " column after WRC Rally Italia Sardegna, the eight-time WRC Champion shared his love of the fabled Safari Rally slated for Naivasha from June 22-25.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "The Frenchman crashed out of Rally Sardinia as a result of a muddy boot slipping off the brake pedal, caused by a last-minute wheel change. He veered off the road in stage 14 in desperately wet conditions, while holding a 4.3s lead over Hyundai’s Esapekka Lappi.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": " Ogier and Kalle Rovanperä- winners of the last two editions in 2021 and 2022 respectively - will both field GR Yaris Rally1 cars for Toyota GazooRacing along with Welshman Elfyn Evans and Japanese Takamoto Katsuta.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": " The Toyota speedster stopped competing full-time after his eighth WRC title in the 2021 season. but has savoured the opportunity to do the events that he really enjoys. He wrote in his column: “I love the Safari Rally. Winning this event is one of the highlights of my career. Really, it’s one of the special ones.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "Ogier is the second most successful driver in the history of the WRC after namesake and compatriot Sebastian Loeb who won it a record nine times in a row.  He won the Safari on its return to the WRC calendar in 2021 and was leading last year’s event until he stopped to change a puncture on the repeat run of the Kedong speed test.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "\"Now, we look forward to Africa and I think we're out of the rainy season in Kenya. The place is quite magical. When I hear about some of the places the WRC is thinking to go to, it really makes me happy to think about being back in Naivasha again.\"", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "“The place,” he wrote, “is quite magical. The people, the country, wildlife and the roads - everything is just amazing. When you look at the people, it’s humbling to see how warm they are and for the welcome they are giving to us. They never stop smiling.\"", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "Safari will count towards the seventh round of the WRC representing one of the season’s most challenging events for the crew and the car. In 2021, Ogier donated Sh2.5 million (€20,000) to two Kenyan charities (Nakuru Children's Project and Ol Pejeta Conservancy) which both received half of the amount.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "Ogier concluded: “The challenge of Safari, it’s unique. It’s not like anywhere else on earth. But we don’t forget: the roads also can be super-tough. You can go from the big, big rocks where you take only first gear into places where you struggle like hell to come through the fesh-fesh, with your face full of the dust.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "set", "attrs": {"id": "m1hxg5wl", "values": {"type": "report_data_table", "data_entries": [{"cells": ["NATIONALITY    ", "France  "]}, {"cells": ["DATE OF BIRTH ", "17.12.1983"]}, {"cells": ["BIRTHPLACE     ", "Gap, Hautes-Alpes"]}, {"cells": ["FIRST RALLY ", "2008, Mexico"]}, {"cells": ["CO-DRIVER    ", "Vincent Landais"]}, {"cells": ["WRC TITLES", "8 (2013-2018, 2020-2021)"]}, {"cells": ["WRC WINS   ", "57"]}, {"cells": ["WRC PODIUMS", "96"]}, {"cells": ["WRC STAGE WINS", "681"]}]}}}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}}], "article_image": "sebastien-ogier_jpg.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3301", "article_excerpt": "Sébastien Ogier has reiterated his love for Africa- and most importantly- Kenya's iconic World Rally Championship round.", "blog_categories": ["sports"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back To News", "article_banner_image": "news-banner.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Rwanda's Giancarlo Shows First Look Of 2023 WRC Safari Livery", "years": [], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["news"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 15, "article_date": "Tue-06-2023", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "With an apparently insatiable appetite for success, Giancarlo Davite has displayed the elegant livery that his Ford Fiesta Rally2 will wear during the 2023 WRC Safari Rally Kenya slated for June 22-25.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Rwandese speed-merchant presented the new look of his luminous marque brimming with confidence ahead of the grueling 19-stage showpiece that will traverse world-famous stages around Lake Naivasha and Elementeita. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "His sponsors Agrotech appear on both sides of the door while his other partners like Osho Chemicals Ltd occupy the space on the bonnet. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This year’s Safari will feature 10 World Rally Team priority 1 cars and 12 Priory 2 entrants and 5 priority 3 contraptions.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "With a more elegant look than his previous years of Subaru STI and most recently Mitsubishi Evolution X, Giancarlo believes his new project will enable him to run the Kenyan premier event competitively against regional and European adversaries. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "\"Today we unveil our Ford Fiesta Rally2 for the next WRC Safari. For the third time running, we shall be competing in a WRC  event, the legendary Kenyan round. And this year we decided to make an upgrade. We entered a Rally2, just behind the most famous Rally1 cars!\" ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Navigator Sylvia Vindevogel who has called Davite’s notes from 2005 sounded quite febrile: “In a few days to the Safari, our Little Bee is looking like our sweet Miss EvoX. Giancarlo and Myself will be taking part in the coming event in partnership with Asad Anwar, Hamza Anwar and a good deal of sponsors, I close one year of bad luck with loads of optimism and looking forward to the fesh fesh dust on areas around Lake Naivasha.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Giancarlo is no stranger to Kenyan gravel roads having tackled his first Safari with compatriot with Savio Muhigana in  2004.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "But the rally gods haven’t been kinder to him either as he has recorded multiple retirements in 2009, 2012, 2013, 2021 and 2022. He has nevertheless erased the jinx with two top 10 finishes in 2019 (7", "type": "text"}, {"text": "th", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "superscript"}]}, {"text": ") in an EVOX and 2004 (9", "type": "text"}, {"text": "th", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "superscript"}]}, {"text": ") in a VW Golf GTI.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Giancarlo continued: \"We know the Kenyan roads. We know how to attack and manage them. There will be only one thing to do, reach the end and the result will follow!  Remember, it is Safari, it is not over until it's over.\"", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Giancarlo is listed among the 14-Rally 2 cars alongside Karan Patel's Ford Fiesta, Oliver Solberg in a Skoda Fabia Evo, Polish star Kajetan Kajetanowicz in a Škoda Fabia RS, Grégoire Munster (Ford Fiesta), Carl “Flash” Tundo (Skoda), Piero Canobbio of Kilifi in a Hyundai i20 NG Rally 2, Aakif Virani in a Skoda Fabia and Czech’s Martin Prokop among others", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "KCB are the official banking partners of the 2023 WRC Safari Rally; also with a three-car line-up in Karan Patell, Evans Kavisi and Nikhil Sachania. Other sponsors supporting the Safari include Talanta Hela, KWS, Cfao Motors (formerly Toyota Kenya) and Government of Kenya (GOK) who are the main sponsors.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "giancarlo.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3301", "article_excerpt": "With an apparently insatiable appetite for success, Giancarlo Davite has displayed the elegant livery that his Ford Fiesta Rally2 will wear during the 2023 WRC Safari Rally Kenya slated for June 22-25.", "blog_categories": ["sports"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back To News", "article_banner_image": "news-banner.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Safari Legends Honored In 70th Anniversary Celebrations", "years": [], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": [], "categories": [], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Mon-06-2023", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Departed and surviving legends of Safari have finally been acknowledged for their distinguished service to the nation in a nostalgic dinner to mark the 70th anniversary celebrations of the fabled event.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "Safari's late legends Shekhar Mehta, Joginder Singh and Prem Choda were among those honored posthumously and their recognition plaques bestowed to their immediate family members.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "Mehta, a five times WRC Safari Rally winner back in the day, had his plaque received by his wife and former navigator Yvonne Mehta.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "The legendary Ann Taeith, who became the first woman to win a round of the KNRC in 1984 spoke on behalf of Women In Motorsports while the legendary Mike Kirkland addressed the occasion; representing the male legends.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "Taeith narrated how Safari \"transformed from a 6000km marathon and endurance event to literally a race\".", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "\"I would like to thank my navigator Sylvia King who has inspired so many women in Kenya. Back in the 1970s, there were not many women involved in motorsports and no African woman I can think of until Orie Rogo Manduli came to the fore. Sylvia (King) and I did many Safaris of the old, many championships and many club rallies. We regularly won the KMSC Rallies in fairly standard cars,\" said Taeith, who retired in her maiden Safari in 1971with Ann McHaedy.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "Kirkland, on his part, revisited his encounters with Eric Cecil aka \"Bwana Safari\" who was the leading light in the founding of the 1953 Coronation Safari Rally which he became a past chairman.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "Kirkland: \"Eric Cecil provided the best fun of our lives and we will forever be indebted to him. Today, I'm wearing a jacket presented to me by Mr Cecil; he truly deserves our respect.\"", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "Sports Cabinet Secretary Dr Ababu Namwamba was the chief guest during the inaugural ceremony accompanied by Safari Rally CEO Phineas Kimathi, a legend in his own right.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "\"This is a real feel of 70 incredible years of Safari and as we continue to walk down the memory lane, we take this opportunity to recognize all individuals who have written this history with the passion that befits this iconic Safari. I would like to instruct that the Safari legends event be an annual ceremony,\" CS Ababu remarked.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "The most dedicated Safari couple of all time- the late Prem and his wife Pauruchistry Choda -also got recognition for their indefatigable driving and gusto for the old type endurance Safari.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "Prem passed on in 2020 but their award as a Safari stalwarts of yore was posthumously handed to his wife in the colorful occasion held at Safari Park hotel; where the 2002 WRC Safari started before being struck off from the FIA calendar for nearly two decades.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "start"}, "content": [{"text": "The Chodas captivated the iconic Safari world in the {"seo": [], "title": "Enterpreneur takes advantage of digital migration to launch education TV station", "years": ["2019"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-12-2019", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "27th Jan, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Since 2012 when she began her television station, she has never looked back despite the teething challenges.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "With a passion of creating alternative learning opportunities for the girl child some of who are either sent home because of one reason or the other and end up getting married off at an early age or those that are sent home because of school fees arrears, she started the long journey.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In 2011, she started with video conferencing and transmitting small TV signals in Korogocho area and after much struggle in 2012, she had an opportunity to meet the then Permanent Secretary, Ministry of Information Communication and Technology, Bitange Ndemo at the TV station’s launch event in September.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“I had a chance to have a brief chat with him and shared the great vision I had in the education sector. With 57 per cent of high school pupils not transiting for their university studies, I knew I had to step in to close in the growing gap in the education sector,” she adds.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Meet Jane Muthiga, Founder of Elimu TV and one among the 30 Free-to-air television investors that started her own station to address the growing needs in the community.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Elimu TV has 24 teachers who are hired on part-time basis and who teach in some of the national schools in the country. This means that primary school children have scored poorly in Kenya Certificate of Primary Education exams have an opportunity to not only get access to education but also to get couched by well-experienced teachers similar to those in a national school would.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A passionate Muthiga explains how the TV programming operates.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“In a typical day, we have six hour classes for form one course that cover various subjects – Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry and Biology, that is from 6am to noon. All these are taught in the ordinary way only that this time, it is recorded and lots of audio-visuals – charts, graphs are used to make the virtual students understand better,” she notes.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Thereafter, we have form two sessions that run from noon to 6pm and form three session that extends to midnight with form four syllabus taught in the wee hours of the night running till 6am.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“In essence, it is a 24 hours 7 days a week process and we alternative the classes just so that it is balanced,” she adds", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Elimu TV works very closely with the Ministry of Education through the Kenya Institute of Curriculum Development (KICD) who provide them with the approved curriculum which they then use.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“Soon after we record all sessions, we normally take the videos for approvals before we share them with Signet partners who then air them through our TV signal and our virtual students then watch from the comfort of their homes,” she notes.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In an interview she explains that her vision is to be the greatest audio-visual content producer in the country. She has great ambitions of producing videos that can even be sold in local retail shops which would also mean additional revenue stream for the station.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The videos are normally 20 minute long that are also uploaded on social media platform – YouTube.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Through an SMS platform, virtual students can then share feedback soon after watching the TV programme or even share their questions through social media platforms – Facebook and Twitter.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The station is soon setting up a call centre that will add value and will encourage real time responses to students asking questions on either of the subjects.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "enterprenuership-with-digital-migration-1727337486.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Since 2012 when she began her television station, she has never looked back despite the teething challenges.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "enterprenuership-with-digital-migration.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Is social media the new customer service desk for banks?", "years": ["2019"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-12-2019", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "27th Jan, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "With social media now synonymous with communication and marketing strategies, banks may be entertaining the idea of finding more effective ways to engage with their customers on such platforms.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Recently awarded the ‘Best Use of Social Media by a Financial Institution’at SMAA, Kenya Commercial Bank talks about how it developed a successful social media platform. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Standard Reporter talks to KCB Digital Marketing Manager Alex Muriu", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Q: How did KCB get started down the social media path?", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "KCB got into Social Media about two years back. It however took about a year before we got the hang of it given the size and nature of our business. Given our customers are increasingly young and savvy, it was only natural that we would go down that path.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Q: Who or what was the catalyst behind the KCB’s social media voice?", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Our voice was dictated by our audience. The customer segment that engages with us online is relatively young and urban or peri-urban. This group is energetic, opinionated and quite vocal about their needs. When they are happy they will tell you, and when they are unhappy they will be even more vocal. Ensuring we created a social media personality that makes us approachable and engaging to our customers is critical to our success so far.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Q: In a sea of social media feeds, what makes KCB’s voice on social media unique?", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "We are the first financial institution locally to take the bold step and become less formal in both our social media commentaries and language. We have used unconventional tactics such as comics, news jacking and humorous posts to get our message across, often having to go outside our comfort zone to connect with our customers. The response has been phenomenal, culminating in us winning the Social Media Africa Awards in January 2015.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Q: How has your social media presence impacted your community outreach?", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This is one area we expect to really amplify this year. However we have used social media to let the world in on our CSR activities such as the Mifugo ni Mali program in Baringo and other counties, and the Kidneys for Life program through which we encouraged our Fans to go for free checkups at our mobile clinics. We realise that our Fans care about the community around them and we will be using our rapidly growing social media influence to involve them in our community outreach activities.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Q: How do you treat the Africa Social Media Awards", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Winning the ‘Best Use of Social Media by a Financial Institution’ award at the SMAA was a welcome validation of what we have embarked upon on Social Media. We have also seen an increase in engagement where more and more customers are realising that they can effectively communicate with us through social media and expect timely feedback. We hope to win more awards in 2015 so this is only but a beginning.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "customers-service-desk-in-banks-social-media-1727337765.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "With social media now synonymous with communication and marketing strategies, banks may be entertaining the idea of finding more effective ways to engage with their customers on such platforms.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "customers-service-desk-in-banks-social-media.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Entrepreneur goes bananas", "years": ["2019"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-12-2019", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "16th Feb, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "MOGOTIO, KENYA:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": "Joyce Macharia is the envy of many farmers in Mogotio, her five acre farm of bananas is the center of attraction in an area that is grouped under the Arid and Semi-Arid lands.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "She ventured into banana farming three years ago having identified a gap in the market, which was shortage of the supply to growing population in her target towns of Nakuru, Naivasha and Nairobi.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Having in mind the big challenge of getting appropriate seeds at the right time, she began by setting up a banana tissue culture laboratory which has become a success and now supplies seeds not only to her farm but also to other farmers in areas as far as Mombasa, Marsabit and Kisii.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“After quitting my job at a local bank, I decided to try a hand in banana farming due to the gaps and opportunities that existed in the industry, I couldn’t understand for instance why we should import bananas from neighboring countries yet we have what it takes to even export to those countries,” she says.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“Before setting up the business, I did a survey and realized that there was a problem in getting seeds to sustain commercial banana farming. How I tackled the challenge was to team up with friends to come up with a proper structure that would sustain our business,” she says.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“So we turned a residential house into a laboratory where we would use to produce seeds into bulk from identified banana varieties,” she adds. “We found out that through this model we are able to produce disease free seeds and also those that are able to easily adapt to local environmental conditions.” ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The laboratory which is located along the Nairobi-Kisumu Highway is an investment worth Sh2 million and has a number of scientists charged with nurturing cells into seeds ready for planting.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "She says most of the capital went into installing tissue-culture banana seedlings production systems that churn out over 10,000 plants every month. The lab has seven employees and each of the three bedrooms turned laboratory is used for different purposes in the production process.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“The workers are separating banana shoots, which will then be planted individually to multiply further.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "They work in groups to separate the shoots using what the agronomist calls clean benches.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The shoots are planted in a mixture of nutrients that include calcium, potassium and phosphorous and hormones that aid in multiplication, all mixed in a special gel.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The multiplication takes four weeks before shoots are separated and multiplied further in another room in a process that takes four weeks. One original shoot, known as meristem, can produce 1,000 plants.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "From the shoots’ production and multiplication units, there is the ‘growers’ room where hormones are further used to aid in roots production.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Plants remain in this room for four weeks. Each shoot is planted in its own sterilised bottle in the special soil and essential nutrients.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Temperatures in the rooms are maintained at between 26-29 degrees Celsius as the plants are fragile and sensitive to too low or too high temperatures.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "From the laboratory, the seeds are taken to the nursery which is located around Ngata area in Nakuru County. At the nursery, the seeds are hardened for around one month before taken to the field for planting. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“We have varieties such as FHIA 17, Chinese Cavendish, Grand Nain, Williams, Uganda Green and the FHIA 18. They are either the ripening or cooking type,” she adds.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "She says banana requires adequate water and at the Mogotio farm what she has done is to do irrigation.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "entrepreneur-goes-bananas-1727337910.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "MOGOTIO, KENYA:Joyce Macharia is the envy of many farmers in Mogotio, her five acre farm of bananas is the center of attraction in an area that is grouped under the Arid and Semi-Arid lands.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "entrepreneur-goes-bananas.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Demand for luxury vehicles pushes up new car sales in Kenya by 12.8 per cent", "years": ["2016"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q1"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Wed-02-2016", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "17th Feb, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "NAIROBI, KENYA: The demand for luxury cars improved significantly in 2015 contributing to an increase in the overall number of cars sold in the Kenyan market.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "According to figures from the Kenya Motor Industry Association, KMI, a total of 19,524 new vehicles were sold last year up from 17,296 vehicles in 2014.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Luxury cars which include BMW, Porsche and Mercedes Benz faired on well during the year pointing to pent-up demand for the brands from middle-income and wealthy motor enthusiasts.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "D. T. Dobie which holds the distributor rights to the lucrative Mercedes Benz franchise saw the sale of Mercedes Benz units jump by 75 per cent to stand at 598 units up from the 342 units sold last year. DT Dobie recently launched a new version of the Mercedes S Class which sells from Sh16 million and is popular among corporate executives.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Porsche which recently opened up offices in Kenya at Sameer Park along Nairobi-Mombasa road moved almost double the units sold by well-established BMW brand which has been in the local market for a long time.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Though a decline from 125 units it sold in Kenya in 2014, Porsche sold 102 units last year compared to 51 BMWs sold in same period. The BMW models, including the X3, X5, and X6 sell at between Sh8 million and Sh18 million, it sold 44 units in 2014, according to the KMI report.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“We sold the units to individuals and private companies,” an official at Porsche’s Nairobi office said. A company, owned by logistics firm Multiple Group, was appointed the local Porsche dealer late 2013 and started taking orders in the second quarter of 2015.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The entry of Porsche with a single showroom in Nairobi’s Sameer Business Park has for the first time given fans of the brand an official local dealer.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "According to data from the Kenya Motor Industry Association, KMI, General Motors maintained its lead over the rest moving a total of 6, 575 units led by its best-selling brand Isuzu which sold 6, 321 units.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Simba Colt motors managed to move 3,153 units of Mitsubishi vehicles across the various classes last year, up from 2,774 units sold in 2014.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "New entrant Crown motors which wrestled the Nisan franchise from D. T. Dobie in 2014 saw its sales for Nisan jump by 475 per cent from 105 units in 2014 to 604 units sold last year.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Japanese car maker Toyota however took a beating with sales of Toyota vehicles and its new Hino brand of trucks and busses shrinking by 15 and 13 per cent to stand at 3442 and 594 respectively.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "demand-for-luxury-vehicles-1727338931.png", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "NAIROBI, KENYA: The demand for luxury cars improved significantly in 2015 contributing to an increase in the overall number of cars sold in the Kenyan market.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "demand-for-luxury-vehicles.png", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

Feb, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "NAIROBI, KENYA: Many Kenyans are opting for apartments compared to maisonettes and bungalows in a new Housing Price Index released by Kenya Bankers Association.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The growing taste for apartments according to the survey which represents trends in the fourth quarter of 2015 is due to skyrocketing prices of land and their affordability on the rental side.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "According to Jared Osoro, Kenya Bankers Association Director of Research and Policy, apartments
