"paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "He said this justifies the increased appetite and relative affordability for apartments by an apparently growing middle class.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“From the real estate developers’ point of view apartments could be yielding high returns given that a number of units can be put up in a small piece of land and the high cost of land as opposed to maisonettes and bungalows which have to be stand alone,” he said.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The survey conducted in areas classified as region one, region two and region three depicts a shift from tradition where areas previously known for maisonnettes and bungalows now embrace apartments.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Region one includes Athi River, Mlolongo, Mavoko, South C, Kitengela and Ruai among others. Region two includes South B, Komarock, Imara Daima, Ngong Road Mbagathi road and Langata among others. Region three includes Kileleshwa, Springway, Adam Arcade, Mountainview and Nyali.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The sub regional indices indicate that apartment prices in all the three regions are clearly on a gentle rising trend.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Kenya Bankers Association launched the survey in 2015 to better guide policy makers and investors on the trends in the housing sector.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "According to the survey which covered fourth quarter of 2015, home prices rose marginally between September and December, suggesting that an end to the sharp hikes of the last decade could be behind us.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Kenya Bankers’ Index shows that property prices around the country grew by 1.14 per cent – slower than the 2.75 per cent reported in Quarter 1 and 1.25 per cent in Quarter 3.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“What we are seeing is stabilization in the homes market,” said Habil Olaka, the chief executive officer at the bankers’ lobby.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The index only covers actual sales that may have been concluded through the involvement of the banks, he added.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A spike in interest rates last year is thought to have slowed homes sales, dampening demand to depress prices.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "But the slowdown is only part of a wider stabilization of the fairly small market whose prices were dictated by a severe shortage. That shortage and the resultant abnormal profits became a huge incentive for developers; especially in the top end of the market that analysts concur has now been oversupplied.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "kenya-bank-association-1727339088.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "NAIROBI, KENYA: Many Kenyans are opting for apartments compared to maisonettes and bungalows in a new Housing Price Index released by Kenya Bankers Association.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "kenya-bank-association.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Low oil prices strain exploration activities in Kenya", "years": ["2016"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q1"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Tue-02-2016", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "23rd Feb, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "NAIROBI, KENYA: A slowdown in local exploration activities witnessed in 2015 is expected to spill over to this year, with oil price free fall set to deny drilling companies cheaper funding, investment analysts have said.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Exploration firms are thus facing tough times ahead with projections they could cut spending on projects, including laying off staff on the back of thinning profit margins and high interests on loans.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Pine Bridge Investment Managing Director, Jonathan Stichbury said the sharp drop in global crude oil prices owing to a glut has pushed oil producing companies to the red, with low cash reserves threaten to disrupt schedule of projects.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“Plummeting oil prices stand in the way of oil firms which could deny them funding at competitive rates, a big impact will be felt on actualization of drilling projects,” said Stichbury.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Kenya’s prospects of being an oil producing country were lifted when one discovery after another was made in 2012. This attracted a number of multinationals keen to cash in on the emerging sector.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "However things have dramatically changed following the unprecedented decline in oil prices which have hit Sh 89 a liter.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The exploration firms that were jostling to have a piece of Kenya’s promising sector have since scaled down their operations significantly with some entirely bolting out.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Analysts say the price could sink further in the coming days despite earlier views that the two year oil out would finally pick up this year.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The analysts however say the dark clouds of dismal oil prices have a silver lining in terms of the prices of products.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A rise in oil prices, they say, could have exposed consumers to higher costs of products.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Nonetheless, Kenya stands to lose immensely as the low fuel prices mean that the dream of joining the league of oil producers is ebbing further as it becomes less economical for first-time oil producers.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Exploration activities in Kenya slowed down by 50 percent in the second half of last year after crude oil prices fell below $50 per barrel.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Oil and gas services logistics firm Atlas Development sacked close to 750 staff members to scale down operations while Tullow Oil and its partner Africa oil decided to sell stakes in their oil blocks to larger companies to raise capital.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Early January 2016 oil prices were recorded below $28 per barrel to maintain an 18 month low streak compounding the reduced investments.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A storm back of Iran into the glutted oil market will push for an enormous strain for exploration firms over the next 12 months.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "International Energy Agency (IEA) said Iran’s return to the market will offset any production cuts from other countries, with projections the oil market could drown in over-supply.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Indication from the agency is that Iran could move faster to look for buyers with competitive offers.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Stichbury is however seeing a situation where oil producing giants like Russia could start creating a net oil supply deficit to stabilize prices.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“I foresee a compromise on supply cut back to allow companies start making profits going forward,” he said.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Oil import bills have gone down by less than a third over the last one month, supported by a stable exchange rate as shilling seen steady at Sh 102 against the dollar.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "low-oil-price-1727339243.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "NAIROBI, KENYA: A slowdown in local exploration activities witnessed in 2015 is expected to spill over to this year, with oil price free fall set to deny drilling companies cheaper funding, investment analysts have said.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "low-oil-price.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "The famous battles between man and machine are back. Rally season is here", "years": ["2016"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q1"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Wed-02-2016", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "24th Feb, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It’s back! The excitement. The adrenalin. The dust. The wind. The twists and turns. The super charged crowd. The Beasts are back! The Kenya National Rally Championship 2016 series is here!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Men and cars has always been one combination that has lasted for ages. Well, its sports and men to be honest, but I’m not taking anything away from the ladies who love the sport. I have a lady friend who loves rallying more than anything, sometimes I think more than clothes and shoes which is inbred in most women; she’s currently training to be a rally navigator and knowing her tenacity, I just might be looking at a future champion.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Before I indulge in the technicalities and what makes rallying in Kenya so great, I need to recognize one lady who makes the rally events run so seamlessly. She makes everything look so easy and at her age, she challenges me to do more with my life. Sylvia King. Sylvia has rallying in her veins. Sylvia who just celebrated her 70", "type": "text"}, {"text": "th", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "superscript"}]}, {"text": " birthday in 2015 is the fabric that holds the organization of any rally together and for that simple fact, I celebrate her.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This year, the rally calendar starts in the County of Kajiado (February 27th). Now, ladies, just so you don’t show up under or over-dressed; Kajiado is hot and dusty, leave your heels at home, don’t wear white unless you plan go trash it after and yeah, don’t wear heels, you’ll end up looking like an ostrich-they don’t have the best walking style. For the guys, stick to shorts and sneakers and you’ll be alright.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This year will see the rally transverse across Nakuru, Kisumu, Eldoret, Mombasa and my all-time favorite, Nanyuki! It’s safe to say that with the addition of Mombasa and Nanyuki to the calendar this year, this will be one of the best calendars we’ve had in a while, so you all better start making those plans.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Last year Jaspreet Chatthe or Jassi as we are used to calling him was on a roll! Jassi from Team Kibos not only won the KNRC championship, but he was also crowned the African Rallying Champion for 2015. Such a spectacular feat especially when you consider that his main rival in the Kenyan series is the phenomenal Tapio Laukkanen who we fondly refer to as the ‘The Flying Fin’ – the only way he knows how to drive is flat out. I need to remember to ask him how he drives when he goes grocery shopping, this guy is a maniac on the circuit-In a good way.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "KCB Group has renewed its sponsorship for the 14th year in the rallying sport. The partnership with Kenya Motor Sport Federation has been great during the last 13 years and hopefully that will continue. It’s always great to see corporates get involved in sports, sometimes it’s not all about making profits, organizations need to invest in the communities they operate in. Key to note is KCB Group’s tag line to the rallying sport “bringing the rally to the people” and having the series run through multiple Counties over the year is a great way of doing just that.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Rumor has it that a few more Ford Fiestas are joining the circuit after they made their debut in last year’s series. I have a feeling that Manvir Baryan & Rajbir Rai who raced in those spectacular tiny machines last year will have something to say about the championship this season. Of course we are also rooting for the tiny Skoda Fabia driven by Quentin Mitchell, he’s pretty confident he’s cracked out how to get the best out of it. The EVO 10s have dominated the series the last couple of years and this year might not be any different. Word on the grape vine is that Carl Tundo is working on a new machine (fuse between a Ford Fiesta & an EVO 10) for this season after ditching the Proton, so yeah, this season will be very interesting.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Enough about the cars. As much as I love talking about these magnificent beasts, there’s so much more about the rally. It’s fun. Rallying is fun. The entire atmosphere around it is fun. From the traveling, to the scenery, to the crowds, to watching the ultimate battles between man and machine, to the great company and great food; it’s essentially a one stop shop to any fun loving person.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "I’ve met some great friends following the rally across the country. I’ve met Dan, I think his name was Dan, I gave him my phone cable and he never returned it (if you own an iPhone you can appreciate my fuss); I’ve met Thairo who follows the rally everywhere and actually made a business out of it. Let’s face it, following the rally you end up in the middle of nowhere and Thairo ensures that when you need to eat, he’s there-he barbecues meat for sale-pretty genius if you ask me.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "So yeah, hopefully we can get to see huge crowds this year in the circuit. This might just be one of the most unpredictable rallying seasons yet. With the new machines and the usual suspects; The Legend Ian Duncan, Tundo, Tapio and Jassi; it sure cannot disappoint.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Rev up! And see you on the 27th of February for the Kajiado Rally; carry your hats, your sunscreen and let’s have fun!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "By: Brian Kuira", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "rallying_behind_the_kings_of_the_track2-1727339392.png", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "It’s back! The excitement. The adrenalin. The dust. The wind. The twists and turns. The super charged crowd. The Beasts are back! The Kenya National Rally Championship 2016 series is here!", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "rallying_behind_the_kings_of_the_track2-1727339380.png", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Treasury turns to the Middle East for second sovereign bond to raise funds", "years": ["2016"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": [], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Thu-02-2016", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "25th Feb, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "NAIROBI, KENYA: National Treasury has set its eyes on Middle East to diversify Government’s sources of international funding. The move is part of the State’s efforts to reduce its domestic borrowing requirements, control interest rates and stabilize the shilling and exchange rate.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Late last month, Treasury CS Henry Rotich said Kenya is working on documentation that would see current banking laws amended to pave way for its first Islamic bond.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "According to Treasury Cabinet Secretary Henry Rotich, the Islamic bond, also known as a Sukuk, would help tap into the country’s Muslim population that has limited access to formal Sharia-compliant banking.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The action by the government is seen as a move that would catalyze economy benefitting both the Islamic population and the nascent Islamic finance industry in Kenya.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Many investors from the Islamic faith in the country and around the world have not been able to participate in domestic borrowing efforts by Kenya’s Treasury and in such other bonds such as the Eurobond due to religious restrictions.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“A sizeable portion of Kenya and the world population profess the Islam faith and this move, therefore, further deepens their participation and financial inclusion,” said players in the industry.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "They expects a spillover effect to benefit non-Muslim  institutions and individuals  with the interest sharing concept that results to less systemic risks in Shariah compliant financing  already growing in popularity.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Government debut into Shariah Compliant financing will further attract development of technical capacity in the country resulting to growth of other instruments of Islamic finance.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "National Bank had last week partnered with global events company Awal to bring to Nairobi the first International Islamic Finance Conference for Africa, an occasion which Kenya’s Treasury Cabinet Secretary Mr. Henry Rotich used to outline the government’s plans for the sukuk bond. The conference was attended by representatives of Islamic Finance institutions and delegates from the countries of the Gulf Cooperation Council.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Speaking during the first International Islamic Finance Conference for Africa, Treasury CS Henry Rotich said that Kenya had ambitions to become an Islamic finance hub.  “Kenya is keen to issue a Sukuk bond as the government reviews other avenues to fund budget financing deficit,” he said.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Last year, the Sukuk market witnessed a debut issuance from four governments that are not part of the Organization for Islamic Cooperation (OIC). This includes the United Kingdom, Hong Kong, Luxembourg and South Africa. Kenya will be the second non-OIC country in Africa to make a debut in the Sukuk bonds market.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "second-sovereign-bond-treasury-1727339602.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "NAIROBI, KENYA: National Treasury has set its eyes on Middle East to diversify Government’s sources of international funding. The move is part of the State’s efforts to reduce its domestic borrowing requirements, control interest rates and stabilize the shilling and exchange rate.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "second-sovereign-bond-treasury.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Boom of the property market in Mombasa gives it a new lease of life", "years": ["2016"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q1"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Mon-03-2016", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "7th Mar, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "MOMBASA, KENYA", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": ": In his office situated at Mombasa Trade Center, Mwenda Thuranira cuts the image of a passionate business man with burning ambition of finding coast residents a better place to call home.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Twelve years ago after an unsuccessful attempt in the aviation industry which took him to the US to train as a pilot, , he founded My Space limited; a Mombasa based property company that links buyers to property sellers, guiding investors on prime areas to build for better returns and also helping developers meet their demands.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "He says through the company, he has been part of multi-billion projects in Mombasa such as the Sh5 billion English Point Marina, and the Sh1.2 billion Nyali view park project among others.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The iconic English Point Marina has a 26-room hotel, conferencing facilities, a roof-top restaurant, a gym and spa, a swimming pool, 96 serviced apartments and eight penthouses. It also has a popular boardwalk that features retail outlets, a water-sports centre and a fully-serviced 88-berth marina.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "During its launch early this year, President Uhuru Kenyatta noted that the facility to (fully funded by KCB Group to the tune of $400M) will put Kenya on the map of the luxury yacht market and the investment is set to open up Coast to the high-end international ocean traveler.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Mr. Thuranira says he traces his passion to property business when as a pilot student in the US he opted to join a construction site as a casual laborer where he worked on different sites for sometimes before moving to work for a property company.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The journey first as a construction worker then at a property firm raised his experience and enabled him to understand the business from a 360 degree view. He says that as a construction worker, he gained the technical experience while in the company where he also learnt business skills which include linking buyers to developers and how to organize financing for buyers.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Around the year 2006 when the United States of America property market went down, he decided to come back home to Kenya and apply his expertise locally. This is what gave birth to My Space limited which currently employs hundreds of Kenyans.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“My journey began after several tries and hands on experience in the property market,” he says in an interview adding that it is the hands-on experience he gained in the US that has made him manage the company in a proper manner.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“I can attest that the real estate industry in Kenya and Mombasa in particular is headed on the right direction with apartments and shopping malls taking up the town which was previously best known for Swahili houses,” he says.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "He says that the booming business in the education sector is also a plus to the coastal region as many universities are setting up branches to reach out to students. Developers are coming up with apartments to host students and also decent buildings for lecturers and teaching halls.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Some of the institutions which have set base in Mombasa include Moi University, Pwani University, Daystar University, Technical University of Mombasa, and Kenyatta University among other colleges.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Since MySpace entered into the real estate market at the Coast it has been able to transform a number of things.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The CEO says they entered into the market during the ‘dark days’ when estate agents were seen as people whose interest was to swindle clients.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "However, the property agent business is now seen as a genuine business which has been able to employ thousands of people.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“We have been able to restore dignity in this noble business. We are now thinking of how best we can improve the business to be able to employ thousands of other jobless youth in this country,” says Thuranira.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "However, there are challenges that hinder the smooth growth of this industry among them lack of proper government systems.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "According to MySpace CEO, there are a lot of bureaucracies involved when one wants to get approval for a plan of a house or property.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "An investor will be forced to walk in and out of government offices for more than six months to get his/her plan approved. These bureaucracies scare away investors.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Another challenge is project financing", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "property-market-mombasa-1727339947.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "MOMBASA, KENYA: In his office situated at Mombasa Trade Center, Mwenda Thuranira cuts the image of a passionate business man with burning ambition of finding coast residents a better place to call home.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "property-market-mombasa.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Higher uptake of smartphones in the Kenyan market paves way for app based taxi services", "years": ["2016"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q1"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Wed-03-2016", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "9th Mar, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "NAIROBI, KENYA: Uber, an app based transport company, has drawn the anger of conventional taxi operators in nearly every market it has entered. Nairobi has been no exception.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The company which promises to revolutionize the transit system had a soft launch in Kenya early last year.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Uber whose estimated worth is set at around Sh3.6 trillion, has made waves in several cities from Johannesburg to London; it made Nairobi its sixth stop in Africa after Johannesburg, Cape Town, Durban, Lagos and Cairo.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Alastair Curtis, Kenya’s Uber representative states in an online statement that Uber is “a low-cost alternative to move you around Nairobi in a safe, cheap and reliable way.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Uber further states that the company’s innovative system provides users-both customers and drivers, with high standards of safety, accurate GPS location tracking, cashless transactions and prompt feedback channels.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Users install the app which allows them to locate nearest Uber drivers to their location. They can then request a ride, available routes and get a fare quote. iPhone users can even get an estimated time of arrival, (ETA).", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Uber is just the latest in a slew of smart solutions designed to help Nairobi residents get from point A to point B without dying from road-rage induced aneurysms.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Data from the Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS) states that the total number of registered motor vehicles stood at 161,813 in 2009.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In 2011 the figure had jumped to 205 841, a 30 per cent increase and as at last year this figure stood at 218,057.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This presents a challenge to the country’s road network, which for several decades had remained undeveloped; a factor that has precipitated into Nairobi’s current traffic situation.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A 2011 study by technology firm IBM monetized the man hours lost on Nairobi’s traffic jams and found that the Kenyan economy loses Sh50 million daily.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The same study found out that driving in Nairobi is the fourth most painful traffic experience in the world coming right after Beijing and Johannesburg.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Ride sharing services like Uber plan to solve the chaos of urban transit in major cities and at the same time reap the benefits from the same.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Uber’s charge formula includes a base fare of shs100 plus four shillings for every minute and shs60 for every kilometer.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Users are charged a minimum fare of sh300 and sh500 for cancelling their taxi orders and payments are made through credit cards.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Critics have however stated that transit apps like Uber might find Nairobi a difficult market to operate in, given the city’s relatively unstructured and loosely regulated transport system.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Easy Taxi is another application which has been enjoying positive uptake among residents of the city.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The application also uses GPS mapping to allow users connect to Easy Taxi-approved cabs nearest to them, estimate the amount of fare needed and have the taxi pick them up often in a matter of minutes.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In December last year, Easy Taxi partnered with Kenya Commercial Bank to consolidate its presence in the Kenyan market.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The partnership will see KCB and Easy Taxi customers download the App and link it with KCB Pepea Cards. Customers will then be able to pay for taxi services using the debit cards.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "According to analysts, the incorporation of KCB Pepea into the Easy Taxi App will increase convenience for customers and reduce over-reliance on cash or mobile money to pay for taxi services.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "According to Peng Chen, managing director, Easy Taxi Kenya, the adoption of smart phones in the country and an increase in awareness among consumers has provided opportunity for companies that seek to disrupt traditional systems like urban transport.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Jumia report on mobile phone sales in Kenya last year stated that one in two mobile devices sold in Kenya today is a smartphone indicating that the country’s mobile phone industry is moving further away from feature phones and more towards feature-packed smart devices.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“Kenyan drivers are more smart-phone savvy and at the same time more people today are used to the idea of smartphones as a service,” he explains.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“Ordering a taxi or having food delivered through an app is something that is more commonplace today.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Mr Chen states that the frustration in the city’s transport system has further helped services like Easy Taxi get a foothold into the market.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“Everyone who uses taxis in Nairobi has had an incident at some point and we are trying to minimize the pain that comes with urban transit,” he states.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Easy Taxi started rolling out Easy Taxi Corporate from the end of last year in an attempt to tap into the lucrative corporate segment.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“The practice in many corporate organizations is that employees use taxi services and then keep the receipts which are then taken to finance for the employee to reimbursed,” explains Mr Chen.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Easy Taxi corporate eliminates the paper work and allows employees to use taxis and because everything is logged in, an expense report is created at the end of each month which is then sent to the company for billing.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Easy Taxi
