A few months ago my friends and I attempted to dispel the notion that Kigali’s entertainment options were limited.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "We arrived in the cultural medley that is Nyamirambo, a short drive from the city. The lot of us were remarkably surprised by the energy reverberating through these streets. This Kigali suburb has progressively molded its leisure landscape over the years; from just bars to discotheque’s, musical shows, theaters and the like.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It was admirable to see a variety of establishments open and vibrant, especially because often times, the active social media population in Rwanda is embroiled in one debate or another about the entertainment gaps that exist in Rwanda.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Is it possible that Rwanda can integrate and nurture a vibrant entertainment culture into the local community? Simply put, yes.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The financial potential of the entertainment sector in Rwanda is immense. Ranging from exhibition entertainment – art fairs, trade shows, theme parks to live entertainment – concerts, theater, discos, comedy shows etc.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "On the other hand, with the growth, other sectors such as foods and beverage, construction, transport, fashion, media, hospitality etc. indirectly benefit through expenditure linkages.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "If you consider more developed countries, revenue generated from the night time entertainment outlets is remarkable.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In 2010 the UK made £66 billion from the entertainment sector alone, accounting for 4% of GDP. Manchester’s registered count of visitors was 150,000 per weekend during the same period albeit with the presence of England’s most successful football team, Manchester United.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Just to put this into context, last year Nigeria’s heavy reliance on oil cost them a considerable portion of their revenue’s when the price of crude oil plummeted from 100 $ to as low as 25 $ a barrel. It had far reaching repercussions for Africa’s largest economy.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Today the Nigerian government is calling for diversification of the economy by fast-tracking industrialization, agriculture and calling for investment into the tourism and entertainment sectors.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A drop in mineral, tea and coffee prices globally puts Rwanda in a similar but less chaotic situation. However it serves as a reminder that the country must constantly seek alternative revenue generating activities to keep track with its developmental goals. Reliance on aid or traditional economic sectors will not be sustainable.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Why can’t Rwanda reinvent herself as the regional hub for entertainment?  We are inherently good hosts which would give us massive competitive advantage in my opinion.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "On the opposite side of the spectrum, vices such as irresponsible consumption of alcohol, noise pollution, commotion, and crime to mention a few exist. However these are controllable risks. Globally, cities with successful recreational sectors have acknowledged the associated risk and have created control-measures to mitigate this risk.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Rwanda can adopt a similar approach. It would be ideal to have a dedicated organization for example to oversee the strategic management of Rwanda’s entertainment sector.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Another road Rwanda can take is documenting a policy (formulated by an association of practitioners working hand in hand with government) that outlines specific requirements for all segments of the entertainment sector. A well written policy would require mandatory features for live entertainment outlets such as security, parking, sound management, and age/alcohol regulation.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "So far in 2016, Rwanda has hosted the World Economic Forum, Interpol General Assembly and the African Union Summit. This is a consequence of a deliberate strategy to improve its Services sector through promotion of Meetings Incentives Conferences and Exhibitions (MICE).", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "While business tourism generates considerable revenue, there is still vast potential in leisure tourism. In most cases they are complementary.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Wouldn’t it be great if delegates extended their stay to experience go-kart racing, paintball, a comedy night, a night at the casino, and perhaps a musical show or two. We would soon be the land of 1000 activities!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The writer is the Head of Marketing & Communications for KCB Bank Rwanda", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "By: Albert Akimanzi", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "rwanda-entertainment-1727343546.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Ever wonder what happens in some of the less common suburbs of Kigali after dusk? The movie revolves around a series of twists and turns that later reveal the financial dealings that are carried out behind the Wall Street boardrooms resulting in the loss of the investors’ hard earned money and the enrichment of corrupt dealers.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The show has lessons for investors to learn from and also offers good comical and emotional relief at the end. A virtue you need if you plan to invest in the stock exchange.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Talk about mesmeric experiences! We need to save our city sooner, rather than later, before we have nothing to show our children and the generation after that.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The late Laureate Wangari Maathai is renowned for her efforts to clean up the environment and preserve our forestry. {"seo": [], "title": "Lucy’s Silky Touch To a Great Textile Industry in Kenya", "years": ["2016"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Wed-10-2016", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "26th Oct, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "As a young student at the University of Nairobi, Lucy Bingham was unaware of where she would end up years later – at the head of an enterprise changing the lives of more than 3,000 households across Kenya.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "While studying design at the university, she was able to gain deep knowledge on such topics of graphics, packaging, textiles and much more.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It was ultimately textiles that pickled her interest. Soon after, Lucy received the opportunity to go to the United States to participate in a program aimed at supporting future leaders in Kenya. While working with ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "Training for Development,", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}, {"text": " she networked with various leaders in the textile industry including the Fabric Workshop Museum.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Lucy began curating a program that trained apprentices interested in pursuing an art career, specifically within the textile industry.  The museum additionally offered Lucy the opportunity to come to Kenya every summer to work among a community to offer her services, which was and still is a keen interest of hers.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“It was 2004 when I came back to Kenya and the country was in the process of revitalizing its textile industry”, Lucy said, “It was soon after that I discovered Makueni.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Makueni County is in eastern Kenya. The introduction to Makueni was as the beginning of Lucy’s journey into the Kenyan textile industry, and ultimately with Tosheka Textiles.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“The owner of the ginnery [in Makueni] was excited about us coming in. So he really helped us in communicating with the community and he connected us with the water community development organization, which allowed us to bypass organizing the community.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It was the organization that allowed Lucy to work with the community as partners to begin the expansion of her textile work. The additional partnership with St. Patrick’s Vocational Training Center, presented an opportunity to work with a community that is well-versed in the textile industry. Through the development of Tosheka Textiles, Lucy has been able to provide a sustainable income to these communities she partners with through the production of her product.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“Overall, it was an attractive location for us and it’s close to Nairobi, plus the ride to Makueni is gorgeous,” she says amusingly.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Additionally, the development of her airy-silk product was conceptualized in Makueni. The silk product is used to increase the quantity of fiber employed in the production of textiles used by Tosheka.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The market value of a meter of raw silk is valued at KSH550 but through the value addition process with the textile, Tosheka sells the product at KSH1,900 – which is a Ksh1,450 margin. The airy-silk product sales projections amount to $1.89 million per annum, with Tosheka receiving a 23 percent net profit margin, which is just shy of $500,000.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Tosheka Textiles is currently the sole producers of the airy-silk product in Kenya and East Africa.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Her experience working in the United States heavily shaped her approach to structuring her business. Initially, she knew that her experience in the States would be reflective of her future in Kenya.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“It’s a question of productivity and how people view their work,” Lucy said in reference to lessons learned while abroad, “It’s how people appreciate their workers, it’s not just about sitting on a screen and print table, or to dye. It’s about how people relate to each other.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Once Lucy was able to formulate a relationship with her partners in Makueni she established Marafiki Arts, which is an exchange program that connects artists in the U.S with a community in Kenya. It allows the artists to come to Kenya to learn more about the industry.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "According to a report published by McKinsey & Co, Kenya, Ethiopia, Tanzania, and Uganda have the potential to trade goods worth Sh300 billion in the garments and apparel industry by 2025.", "type": "text"}, {"type": "hardBreak"}, {"text": "It would be a massive increase for a region that exported about Ksh34 billion worth of apparel in 2014.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "McKinsey however says the vast potential will only be attained if major global apparel companies open sourcing offices in East Africa – which is what Tosheka is doing in its own small way.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“Back in the 90s the textile industry was very vibrant and I can now see history repeating itself.  Through our introduction of the airy silk fabric, we are looking to engage a supply chain of more than 3,000 households,” says Lucy. “Things that were made outside of the industry can now be locally produced. It’s very exciting.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Understanding the potential for the growth the industry maintains, Lucy stresses the need for partnerships. From curating a relationship with her producers to appearing on Lions’ Den ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "watch here", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "link", "attrs": {"rel": null, "href": "https://bankika.co.ke/lionsden/videos/kcb-lions-den-ep-1/", "title": null, "target": null}}]}, {"text": ", she has continuously practiced the philosophy of harnessing relationships.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“I chose equity because I wanted a strategic partner. Equity is about bringing people together and it’s not always about the money. The partnership can bring into the company what is needed,” she stated, “Debt is a means of getting somewhere but getting a strategic partner is having someone that has experience, clout and connections.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Lucy’s appearance on Lions’ Den successfully awarded her with a partnership with investors Olive Gachara and Wandia Gichuru. They agreed to invest KSH 8 Million for a 20 percent stake.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Lucy is positive about the future of Tosheka Texiles. “I see our main product, the airy-silk which is the first in the country and the first to be commercialized, to be a brand leader in Kenya, East Africa and globally as a product being sourced from Africa,” she stated.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "And the growth prospects?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“Our core work is in producing textile in the form of fabric. It can be applied in any form – clothing, hospitality, furniture,” says Lucy. “It’s a huge industry and there is a large shortage of suppliers. We can be applicable to the larger market in any form.”", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "lucy-silky-touch.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "As a young student at the University of Nairobi, Lucy Bingham was unaware of where she would end up years later – at the head of an enterprise changing the lives of more than 3,000 households across Kenya.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "lucy-silky-touch-1727351194.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Psychology Counts When You Present A Business Pitch. Here’s How.", "years": ["2016"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Thu-10-2016", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "27th Oct, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Any time an individual appears before a group of people, whether for a job interview, to pitch for business or to present a proposal to a bank loan officer, there’s a psychological angle, usually unseen and unspoken, that can often influence the decisions made. Psychologist Mbutu Kariuki breaks it down.", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": " ", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}, {"type": "italic"}]}, {"text": "Q: How should one prepare psychologically for a big event like pitching a business to potential investors? Athletes warm up before going into a race. What are the psychological warm-ups that would be helpful before taking a plunge into the Lions’ Den.", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A: ", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": "Mbutu Kariuki:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}, {"text": " Appearing before the LIONS can be intimidating to an upcoming entrepreneur. However, a number of events/activities before the presentation can help in lessening the anxiety. These include, one, watching similar previous shows and interviews of successful entrepreneurs. This will give a clear understanding of the anatomy of such presentations, expose one to business language and act as a pointer to the common mistakes that lead to the rejection of proposals.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Two, do a timed presentation of your idea to colleagues, family, friends or mentors and incorporate their feedback. This is a good way to practice presenting sensible, short and precise answers. It helps build confidence and clarity of ideas. Always have your figures and projections right and at your fingertips.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Three, work on your emotions. Learn to take feedback (questions or criticism) seriously and positively. For example, if you find yourself shouting at someone, getting irritated, thinking “that’s a stupid question” etc…it could be an unconscious cover-up for your weak ideas. Ask for help.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Four, practice doing presentations when alone. Is the business idea even sensible to you? Do you have difficulties answering your own questions? Speak to an imaginary crowd when alone at home or in the office (believe me, this is not a sign of a splitting mind!).", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Five, remain positive and optimistic. Appreciate yourself for the opportunity. Being selected to participate is already good success.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Finally, get enough rest and sleep (especially on the night before the presentation). Waking up tired may only worsen matters – make you more irritable and could easily dent your image.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Q: How does the psychology of first impressions come into play?", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": "The first encounter with the LIONS will definitely contribute to the impression they form about the budding entrepreneur. Normally, the first impression is the lasting impression and subsequent attempts to change this impression may not count for much. This is referred to as ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "primacy effect ", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}, {"text": "– the enduring quality of initial impressions. Here, the entrepreneur should endeavor to put his/her best foot forward: Impression management (self-presentation).", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "However, the big question remains: Should the presenters try to act naturally and be themselves, or should they deliberately change their behavior to get the LIONS  ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "watch here", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "link", "attrs": {"rel": null, "href": "https://bankika.co.ke/lionsden/videos/kcb-lions-den-ep-1/", "title": null, "target": null}}, {"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " ", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": " have a more favorable impression? My take is that being at our best should not be at the risk of sounding exaggerated and insincere.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Some crucial tips to help in the impression management would include using the right nonverbal cues: smile often, maintain an open posture, lean forward if sitting, maintain a high degree of eye contact, and frequently nod your head in agreement with what the interviewer is saying [remember not to overdo it – you will look insincere]. If these cues are not natural to you, try to consciously apply them during the session.  For example, if you are shy and not comfortable maintaining eye contact look slightly above the LIONS’ heads (not up). This trick works!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Second, conform to situational norms. For example, you could wear same form of dress like the LIONS (official, smart casual? – the idea is not to appear significantly different unless you are selling the fashion itself); language – strictly avoid jargon, heavy vocabularies (this is not a grammar class) and curses (sincerely no f words); and etiquette – observe good manners. Always keep in mind that you are asking people to invest in you.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Third, appreciate others. If working as team, acknowledge the input of others. “I did”, “I shall” will only present you as selfish. Even if alone, create an impression that you have been a beneficiary of help at some point (which is often the case) and would do better with more help. This is why you are here in the first instance.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Q: The word “influencer” gets thrown around a lot in business, but how does the power of persuasion really work?", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": "It is important for the presenter to know that the LIONS are people with beliefs, intentions, motivations and attitudes. Hence, Attempts to influence them could actually be an uphill task.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "There are many factors involved in persuasion [and attitude change] but I propose the following as organized around the main elements of the communication process: 1) The source (who conveys the message?). The presenter should endeavour to look attractive, likable and trustworthy. 2) The communication (what is the message?). The conundrum here is if the presenter should employ a rational or emotional strategy. That is, should they use basic motivators e.g. love, sex and fear or use fact or logic to persuade? We know that emotional appeals are very powerful, but how applicable would they be in this setting? 3) The medium (how is the message conveyed?). Unlike in an ad placed on tv or newspaper this is a face to face encounter. Hence tips offered above in the impression management apply. 4) The target (who receives the message?). For example, it may be easy to influence younger people than older ones. I am not sure where to place the current LIONS.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Q: Is it important to research the potential investors before going to pitch your business? What should you be looking for?", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "A:", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}, {"text": "Absolutely yes. Everything – e.g. core business interest, figures, possible areas of conflict with your idea, areas of unfair competition with you (be wise, you could simply be giving away the goose that will lay you a golden egg) and, above all, possible areas of cooperation.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "So, how does one deal with an unsuccessful pitch?", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "bold"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "An “am out” verdict is definitely heart breaking. Fact, a presenter who attributes failure to something inside him/her will only be courting more pain, guilt, stress and perhaps depression. Fact, the “am out” verdict is not a judgement on your character, personality, intelligence or state of mind. It is about the best way to run a profitable business – which is a skill. And skills are acquired. Go for it.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "But one who might say, “This was a unique opportunity for me to test my idea….” would be more likely to try again and succeed!  It is important to be realistic about the only two possible outcomes.  Avoid blame games. Resilience is the hallmark of all successful entrepreneurs. It is the ability to bounce back. Rather, pick the questions asked, criticisms, disapprovals and use them to have a better understanding of your business idea.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Mr Mbutu Kariuki is a Nairobi-based Consultant Psychologist with special interest in Workplace Well-being. He holds a Bachelor of Psychology Hons (UoN), MPhil Psych (Cambridge), and is currently a PhD candidate at University of Otago, New Zealand. (mbutukariuki@gmail.com)", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "psychology-1727351595.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Any time an individual appears before a group of people, whether for a job interview, to pitch for business or to present a proposal to a bank loan officer, there’s a psychological angle, usually unseen and unspoken, that can often influence the decisions made. Psychologist Mbutu Kariuki breaks it down.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "psychology.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Pink Isn’t Just A Color, It’s An Attitude", "years": ["2016"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-12-2016", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "4th Nov, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "October was breast cancer awareness month and for 31 days in the year, the world was painted all shades of pink.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The tide has changed when it comes to thoughts about cancer with just a few years ago, the mere utterance of the word sent shivers down some of our spines.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "We’re in a new age now where the word has gained a more positive response and it’s about time!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In this case, cancer patients are warriors, they are survivors and overall sources of inspiration.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Research has shown that in every circle of friends, at least 2 of 3 individuals have cancer or have relatives suffering or have succumbed to the disease.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "What this has created, is a community that is built on support and optimism.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This is not an exclusive club, nor a secret society. It’s a growing family open to all. That includes you!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Your part in all this is simplified to one thing: Be present and aware.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This ranges from offering emotional support, to actively participating in awareness activities such as check-ups, to simply learning and understanding more about cancer.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "October, as the annual celebration of Breast Cancer Awareness epitomized the above.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This period was dedicated to all the breast cancer warriors who have victoriously battled the disease and celebrated the lives of those who have succumbed to it.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Now for the men in the house. This is not a conversation that exempts you.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "While breast development in men stops at puberty that of women does not. However, the presence of breast tissue is a reality in both male and females. It is then no longer a wonder that men too can develop breast cancer.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The lack of awareness in male breast cancer and misconceptions that try to prove that men cannot develop breast cancer has led to devastatingly high mortality rates. The truth, however, still remains, men have breasts and they too can develop breast cancer.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Regular screening will ensure that if at all there are suspicious cells, they are detected in good time. Early detection is the window of opportunity that separates you from the unknown.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Breast Cancer awareness does not end with the close of October, however.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Think of it as more of a springboard to become more proactive and conscious in our efforts to win the fight against not just breast cancer but all types of cancer.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It is also a call to action for all those who may have missed on the free screening activities. It’s high time for us to drag along aunties, uncles, mothers, fathers, girlfriends, boyfriends, sisters and brothers for these screenings. There are even apps that guide you on how to perform a DIY breast check; so no excuses.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "As we say hello to a new month, wear pink in support of breast cancer awareness. Wear it  all year round. Wear it proud.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Make a personal pledge to become a cancer warrior today because tomorrow, you just might save a life.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "beware_of_counterfeits.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "The tide has changed when it comes to thoughts about cancer with just a few years ago, the mere utterance of the word sent shivers down some of our spines.", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "beware_of_counterfeits-1727351933.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "Fear of Missing the Obamas (FOMO)", "years": ["2016"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Wed-11-2016", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "9th Nov, 2016", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "As the world prepares to usher in the new American president, the majority can only look back to the nostalgic feeling that engulfed the whole universe on such a day eight years ago.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It was a different feeling than what exists now as the world was at that time witnessing the rise of the first Black – American President of the free world.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "There was just this ray of hope in everyone’s heart that no one could explain and his years in the oval office prove that he served the world well. He brought much more meaning to being black even through America’s and the World’s darkest time.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "True composure, stealth and the perfect gentleman. So this time around let us dedicate this round of Throwbacks to none other than America’s greatest and truest – First Black Family.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Barack Obama was the truest definition of a smooth operator – by this, I don’t mean his ability to sweep women off their feet with his romantic gestures to Michelle (Okay, well that too) But in actual sense, this guy was able to fit in literally everywhere.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "His ability to adapt to any situation and handle it in the most mature manner possible, was admirable in every way. You didn’t have to understand English to be captivated by his address.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This level of leadership and character can only be respected as the world waits for a leader of his stature to rise up again. (Hopefully, we won’t have to wait too long) His absolute soberness and compassionate ways to relate to the toughest or joyous of times also proved that leaders are only human.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Who would ever forget the many times he broke into song? No one really cared, we all enjoyed and treasured such moments.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Of even more interest was that his vocals never let him down and his tunes easily resonated with the audience and this only made the world love him even more.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Barack and Michelle were the decade’s Best couple and their relationship proved that true love did actually exist. "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Luck had arrived in the form of Dr. Balozi Bekuta, who as it turns out is a lecturer at Moi University in Eldoret.  He helped get Sam the sample he needed as well as {"seo": [], "title": "Here is why we should celebrate our biodiversity", "years": ["2017"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Tue-05-2017", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "30th May, 2017", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "If you take a drive from Mombasa to Busia, a distance of only 1,000km, you will be exposed to Kenya’s rich diversity of ecological areas and rich ecosystems; Ranging from the marine life to the mangrove forests of the coast; the semi-desert of Taru; the chilly highlands of Limuru and the thick green forests of the Rift Valley.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The celebration of the International Day for Biological Diversity under the theme “Biodiversity and Sustainable Tourism” is an opportunity to raise awareness of the important contribution of sustainable tourism both to economic growth and to the conservation of biodiversity. The 2017 theme, “Biodiversity and Sustainable Tourism” has been chosen to coincide with the observance of 2017 as the International Year of Sustainable Tourism for Development and can contribute to ongoing initiatives such as the Sustainable Tourism Programme.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "According to the Sustainable Development, Biodiversity loss has been identified as one of the Planetary Boundaries that we need to address in order to stay within safe margins. And this makes the preservation of this biodiversity vital for all humanity. In the whole world and in Kenya too, species are going extinct at an alarming rate due to human activities. There has been a rapid population increase, deforestation, poverty, land degradation, lack of education and so on.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The National Environment Management Authority (NEMA) records that there are over 35,000 species of flora and fauna. In fact, Kenya is ranked second highest in Africa for its abundant mammal and bird species. Kenya’s rich ecosystem are all used for agriculture, energy production, pastoralism, water catchment areas, nature reserves, fisheries and tourism. All these are fundamental to our food production and socioeconomic development.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Regardless of its small nature, our coastal forests are also rich in plant diversity and indigenous Furthermore, the freshwater and saline ecosystem (8% of Kenya’s surface area) is an important area of biodiversity, food production as well as socioeconomic development. So every now and then, we get post cards and lots of pictures pale Wozzap family group.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "My aunties are hell-bent on taking pics in the snow yet wakiwa Kagundo, the cold was bad for their bones. Suddenly, my Holy Jane aunties are pictured squeezing on tiny cocktail stools sipping brightly colored mocktails at a ‘Welcome to the Neighbourhood’ barbeque with a jungu family. I haven’t mentioned how my mom’s sister ‘garra talk like this’ – she picked her accent at the airport akingoja cab. I have a cousin Njambi who left Kenya akivaa skirt za gorofa and frilled sweaters; Yeezy is the theme on her Instagram. Of course, there’s the occasional Balenciaga black T-shirt which she tucks on one side in her blue boyfriend jeans. She often pairs these with ridiculously thick Yeezy sneakers. There’s just something about the states!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "So you can imagine how happy I am to hear that I’ll be in the list of KCBae’s diaspora team that will be ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "touring the States", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "link", "attrs": {"rel": null, "href": "https://ke.kcbgroup.com/diaspora/", "title": null, "target": null}}]}, {"text": "  to meet Kenyans living there to discuss what you could make work for you back at home. Na hii KCB huwa imewapenda sana! Mara Dubai, mara Austalia! Please, and thank you. ‘I can TOTALLY see it happening and it’s like SUPER RAD… OMGeee, guys!’", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "I now leave you with a photo of my watuz. You can already hear them just by looking at them… ☹", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Love yours.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Over&Out,", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Witty Banker", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "wakenya-marekani-1727361304.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "Of things that will never make sense. You should have seen us everywhere, sisi na the Nyamwezi traders one side!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It was all going well, in fact in my head I wasn’t single – until the day of meeting fwain ghel’s folks came. Niliambia Johnni ingekuwa weird mi kuenda but hakuna mtu kichwa ngumu kama mwanaume anajiamini. So we went ?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Kumbe fine ghel walikuwa mabarbie hivi???? I saw their house and compound nikakumbuka tule tumia tatu nilikuwa na changia for dates but cha muhimu ni uhai. So the dad suggested we go for a game of golf pale Muthaiga. Ushamba si ushamba. Let’s just say that was the last time we ever saw fine ghel.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Fast forward to present day 2018, we are older and wiser. So jana I was at Karen Country Club for the launch of KCB Karen Masters golf tourney. The first thing that grabbed my attention was the green. Wueh, kuna nyasi na kuna nyasi. Nyasi zingine ni za group of schools nani. The place is scenic.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The set up was really awesome. The photo section had this royal seat manned by two African themed bodiis, symbolizing the 152 kings of golf that will be battling it out for the prize money of $150,000. Bauss! Ukiona prize money imewekwa in dollars, ujue hiyo ni compe serious! Imagine probox ngapi unaweza buy na hiyo doh bana! Tafakari hayo.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The tournament runs from 17", "type": "text"}, {"text": "th", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "superscript"}]}, {"text": " July – 22", "type": "text"}, {"text": "nd", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "superscript"}]}, {"text": " July. If you’re a golf fanatic or are looking to have a good time, keep it here for ticketing info. After the ground shaking remarks from the organizers and title sponsors KCB’s Paul Russo, there was dance. Na si odi dance my fren’. Alafu the confetti was blown up in the air, officially launching the KCB Karen Masters 2018 tournament and unveiling the blue jacket. Hiyo mbwenya ndo winner atapata in addition to scooping a good chunk of change (think of it as a fleet of many proboxs).", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "KCB as the main title sponsors have given 12 Million Kenya shillings towards the event. This sponsorship is just the beginning of many more to come.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Did I mention that this KCB Karen Masters tournament is part of the Sunshine Tour Golf tournament? Inakuanga huko South Africa ,lakini this year wameamua Kenya needs to be part of the action (2018 really is our year!)  This time round its top players will be playing in the KCB Karen Masters, taking the whole tournament to a whole new level.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "More reason why you shouldn’t miss out on this event. {"seo": [], "title": "Paying it Forward", "years": ["2018"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q3"], "categories": ["blogs"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Thu-07-2018", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "12th Jul, 2018", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "But Kenyan watchies…", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "I have never seen a meme more relatable (and I have seen MANY memes) than the one that says “Unasalimia watchie mara tatu, hivyo tu ukona deni yake.”", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Where I live, parking is a problem. We can’t all comfortably park our cars. When you wake up in the morning, you are met with a sight similar to ordering a cab in the CBD. Issa mess. So if you come late, be sure your morning will start with an irate caretaker banging on your door ‘usongeshe gari ama ulete key nikuondolee’ – Also, hmph! That last one is usually a test of my Christianity. If you want to have a good start to the day, just park your car outside the gate under the trees that tower our ka-mini driveway.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "I haven’t perfected the enviable art of reversing without endangering the lives of our neighborhood stray animals, so I prefer to park outside… let’s say preferred.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "We got a new watchie who was obviously not with the program… It all started with my faithful hallos to the man. He would hit me with ‘Madam unaona nilichunga gari jana. Wapi chai yangu?’ and many versions of the same. Like WHO GIVES ME CHAI FOR DOING MY JOB???!!!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "It went on for a while… must have given the chap like Kshs3K in a span of three or so weeks ya chai… mimi mwenyewe ata sikunywangi chai…", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "One day I came home to dry taps. Out of the blue. There’s no feeling that compares to having to deal with that. Even the KRA website hanging didn’t irritate me as much. By the way, wangapi hatuku-make the deadline? ? ?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "So, I packed my clothes ready to go to my friend’s because we cannot compromise a shower. I found my neighbours Kamukunjiing hapo kwa parking complaining tu. Na vile sisalamiangi watu except my extortionist watchie, I just pitad and went on about my temporary moving plans. Then I saw my debtor approaching fast and if there’s anything I loathed is the fact that I couldn’t hasten that automatic window shut! So he caught me midway…", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "I started wondering where I would find him a note because God forbid I dare accumulate my ‘debt’.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Me: Ah, Mkubwa!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Mkubwa (and I mean the Watchie ?): Salam asana. Ni kutoka?", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Me: Eeh, Hata mimi sina maji lakini nikona rafiki anaishi karibu na kesho natoka mapema…", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Mkubwa: Ah, fanya hivi. Wewe rudi kwako. Maji ya kuoga nitapanga vile itakufikia. ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "turns to the estate shopkeeper", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "italic"}]}, {"text": " Mutiso, peleka mitungi tatu kwa huyu madam pale H9.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "I dillydallied between basin-bathing at mine and going to infringe my buddy’s comfort. I hadn’t even asked what they were doing. My house won. I thanked the guy and told him I’d sort him in the morning but he fervidly turned down my offer. Even chasing me to go rest.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "I had my night bath. I was thankful but nothing sucks like the thought of waking up early kuchemsha maji. I instinctively went to my taps and I had an amazing bath with lavender beads to seize the moment. I was to later learn my watchie physically halfway filled my emergency tank. He said to me that I’d helped him many times and this was his way of saying thanks. Mine was the only apartment with water that day before we got sorted.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Gratitude is not just saying ‘thanks’. It’s either giving back or paying it forward. Similarly, KCBae is giving back to you with the Simba points program.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "When you transact with your credit, debit or pre-paid card, use KCB mobi on *522#, bank online with KCB i-Bank or use our KCB mobile app, deposit money at any KCB Mtaani agent, process your salary, or even take a loan, mortgage or insurance cover, KCB rewards you with Simba points.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "These points are redeemable for travel, online shopping, vouchers, airtime and so much more!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "We thought we’d spruce things up a little bit and make it possible for you to redeem for cash! Keep your eyes peeled but in the meantime, ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "here’s", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "link", "attrs": {"rel": null, "href": "https://simbapoints.kcbgroup.com/ke/Aboutus.aspx", "title": null, "target": null}}]}, {"text": " how to enroll for Simba Points!", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Wacha I go chanua my watchie.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Peleka udaku pia!", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "paying-it-forward-1727425138.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3237", "article_excerpt": "I have never seen a meme more relatable (and I have seen MANY memes) than the one that says “Unasalimia watchie mara tatu, hivyo tu ukona deni yake.”", "blog_categories": ["trending"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to Blogs", "article_banner_image": "paying-it-forward.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

Are we together? KCBae is bae because of its belief in sports, talent and opportunity. You know what this sponsorship does other than give a reason to grace Karen Club for what will no doubt be a spectacular event? It nurtures and grows talent and further opens up Sub-Sahara Africa to the Sunshine Tour. To sum that up; = opportunity.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Other African countries represented in the Sunshine Tour include Ethiopia, Tanzania, Senegal, Rwanda, Malawi, Ghana and the Seychelles.
