{"seo": [], "title": "Battle Of Sebs Set To Spice Up WRC Safari Rally Kenya", "years": ["2022"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q2"], "categories": ["news"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-05-2022", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Sebastian Ogier and his namesake Sebastien Loeb will for the first time in history go for each other's jugular on Kenyan soil at next month's WRC Safari Rally Kenya in Naivasha.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Both megastar Frenchmen will be gracing the iconic Kenyan fixture for the second time in their colorful racing careers which have culminated into a combined 17 World Rally Championship (WRC) titles.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Loeb is indeed the most successful of the two speedsters with nine titles to his name while Ogier is an eight-time world champion.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "There is already some good humoured banter locally as purists predict a scintillating battle of titans.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Kenyan navigator Victor Oundi is convinced that the Safari is most likely to go to either of the Sebs. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "\"My money is on Loeb for the simple reason that the current generation Ford is really awesome. Hyundai still hasn't found the mojo. Lately Neuville looks like he’s really over driving it to get results so Hyundai is not likely to be impressive. Ogier, being the defending champion is no pushover, so thrills and spills are guaranteed.\"", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The French speed merchants share many things in common being namesakes and compatriots. They're both on partial WRC campaigns this season, which means that they're only partaking in selected events.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "So, their  Safari rivalry couldn't have come at a better time when the WRC has transitioned into the hybrid Rally 1 era.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Loeb, 48, is returning to Kenya after two decades. He finished fifth on his debut Safari in 2002 behind the wheel of a Citroen Xsara WRC.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Ogier, on the other hand, won last year’s world championship return to Africa in a dramatic last leg comeback.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "On his very first outing in Kenya, Ogier told journalists that he is no longer interested in chasing Loeb's record of 9 titles. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Here's what he told the DirtFish Website: “Safari is a rally I have considered in my partial championship campaign of four or five rallies this year.\"", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“I really enjoyed.the rally last year with the nature and the people and the welcome we got. {"seo": [], "title": "KCB Foundation Issues Laptops to University Scholarship Students", "years": ["2022"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q4"], "categories": ["news"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Fri-11-2022", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The KCB Foundation has donated 50 laptops to university students under its scholarship programme.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The laptops are part of the enhancement to the programme launched last year that saw the Foundation revamp its scholarship programme to incorporate University scholarships in its portfolio. This is in addition to the existing high school scholarship programme that will see it spend over KShs. 2.8 Billion over the next ten years in the Education pillar.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Every year, the top 50 performers from the high school programme will now receive university scholarships catering for the tuition fee in any public university in Kenya, in what kicked off with the 2020 KCSE class.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The University Scholarship Programme will facilitate a smooth transition for the top performers who attain a mean grade of A and A- and the best 2 students living with disabilities each year, from the KCB Foundation High School programme.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“The laptops are part of a deliberate effort by the Foundation to enable the scholars to effectively undertake their schoolwork as well as access their virtual class lessons” said Rosalind Gichuru, KCB Group Director Marketing, Corporate Affairs and Citizenship.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“We want our Scholars to have an equitable opportunity by continuing to access their class courses and complete their assignments on time. With many of them coming from marginalized communities, access to a laptop for purposes of following the classroom lessons or undertaking assignments was going to be a big challenge,” she added.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "This follows the KCB Foundation annual apprenticeship programme that was introduced in May, where the top 50 from their 2020 high school scholarship cohort got a three-month apprenticeship at their local KCB Bank branch.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The scholarship programme started 14 years ago with the aim of supporting efforts to increase the transition rate from primary to secondary school. The KCB Foundation supports 240 students from across Kenya annually, 40 of them Persons with Disability, by providing a full four-year scholarship in public schools catering for school fees, stationery, and uniforms. Additionally, each of the students is assigned a mentor from their local KCB Bank home branch for quarterly one-on-one mentorship sessions.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Out of 240 scholars sponsored last year, 77% of them attained a mean grade of C and above while 48 students recorded a mean grade of A and A–(minus).", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "kcb-ke-logo-1729242311.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3301", "article_excerpt": "The KCB Foundation has donated 50 laptops to university students under its scholarship programme.", "blog_categories": ["business"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to News", "article_banner_image": "kcb-ke-logo-1729242305.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}

{"seo": [], "title": "MKLO Corporate Backing Set to Drive Female Participation In Golf", "years": ["2022"], "cta_icon": null, "cta_link": null, "cta_text": null, "quarters": ["q1"], "categories": ["news"], "enable_cta": true, "updated_by": 30, "article_date": "Sat-02-2022", "article_text": [{"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The level of organization and enthusiasm for women’s golf appears to be changing for the better, thanks to a significant increase in corporate support for the ongoing Magical Kenya Ladies Open (MKLO).", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "While hosts Vipingo Ridge look to make this prestigious event a permanent annual fixture on the Ladies European Tour (LET), they also harbor plans to make it bigger and better every year at Africa's only PGA-accredited Baobab Course which is situated in the vast Kilifi County.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The essence, according to key stakeholders, is to extend support for a gender-equal sporting environment.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Esther Waititu, KCB Director- Corporate, believes women’s golf will definitely go places with “sustainable commitment into the future”.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "“We are committed towards championing inclusivity in the sports arena across all fields. By sponsoring the Kenya Magical Ladies Open, we’re providing a platform for lady golfers from the region to compete and grow to the next level of their career. This then enables them to hone skills and experience which is paramount in the overall growth of the sport,” Waititu remarked at the picturesque Vipingo course where the creme de la creme of the LET are fighting it out for a prize fund of Ksh 38 million. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Waititu underscored the need to grow sporting talent locally, across the various sporting fields.: “This is why our sponsorships cut across various disciplines in golf, football, chess, volleyball and athletics. We continue to build and grow careers, enhancing the competitiveness of the sport and supporting livelihoods. In regards to inclusivity, we have also seen the Bank commit billions of shillings towards funding women owned and women run enterprises.  This is in tandem with KCB's women's proposition agenda to ensure we create equal opportunities in business and sports.\"", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "She added: “Sponsorships can help leverage equal visibility - and this can drive further female participation in sport. Sponsoring women's sport can also make good business sense for key brands through supporting grassroots community sports activity,” added Waititu.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "KCB has sponsored the MKLO from inception. The event was first held in 2019 before taking a two-year break due to COVID-19-related disruptions.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The event is also part of the fabled Ladies European Tour which was founded in 1978.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "In partnership with tournament organisers ", "type": "text"}, {"text": "U.COM", "type": "text", "marks": [{"type": "link", "attrs": {"rel": null, "href": "https://urldefense.com/v3/__http:/u.com/__;!!PrCk3bU!3IHHmTmYMI-sK7enZ6ZpPZE7E1egYM8WzpIns3Mu64lYXZ83u0__Zc1FAMdYA0eGyIOLommC$", "title": null, "target": null}}]}, {"text": " Event, Vipingo Ridge currently has a five-year contract with the LET but its chairman, Alastair Cavenagh, says there is consideration to make it a lasting event. ", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "\"We hope it is going to become a permanent feature. Our contract with the Ladies European Tour is five years; we are into the second year now, but there's no reason why it shouldn't be a permanent feature. So, let us wait and see,\" he said.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "Whilst this second edition of the MKLO has attracted a field of 96 and a prize purse of KES 30 million, Alastair hopes it will grow into an even bigger tournament to match the size of the men’s European Tour event, the Magical Kenya Open, in Nairobi.", "type": "text"}]}, {"type": "paragraph", "attrs": {"textAlign": "left"}, "content": [{"text": "The Government of Kenya recently announced a KES 250 Million sponsorship towards the Magical Kenya Open, and KES 30 Million for MKLO.", "type": "text"}]}], "article_image": "kcb-ke-logo-1729242542.jpg", "back_cta_link": "entry::3301", "article_excerpt": "The level of organization and enthusiasm for women’s golf appears to be changing for the better, thanks to a significant increase in corporate support for the ongoing Magical Kenya Ladies Open (MKLO).", "blog_categories": ["sports"], "article_location": "Lorem Ipsum", "article_subtitle": null, "article_back_to_text": "Back to News", "article_banner_image": "kcb-ke-logo-1729242536.jpg", "enable_article_subtitle": null, "home_slider_banner_image": null, "enable_article_home_slider": false}
